commit_message:
Counter renaming

Add naming rules to doc

Rename root_disk_size -> disk.root.size

Rename ephemeral_disk_size -> disk.ephemeral.size

Rename floating_ip -> ip.floating

Rename volume_size -> volume.size

Change-Id: I4f99dd12efeea3acffbb79b551246b9e506d82a4

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the rewrites of the policy code, but I'm not so sure about this addition. Giving too much freedom in the control of policy rules leads to inconsistently defined rules. If some policy checks can return "roles" to allow for different behaviors then we have some policy controls being defined in the policy engine, and some in the how the results of the call are used. I can see this leading to a big mess in the future. 

I think the policy implementation is clearer when every complex policy decision is "denormalized" into one action and one target with a simple true-false response. If you want some roles to be able to (for example) modify a specific field, then there should be an action for modifying that particular field. Otherwise I think the policy will become overly complex and hard to follow.'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This is Kevin's work, I just split up the patch - hence my +2"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've moved the thread to the mailing list: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-October/001566.html"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-11 16:28:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Reverted

This patchset was reverted in change: I76751a6b4e096443f7dfea1e5dba595790cc6ec1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for finer-grained policy decisions

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Add support to the new policy language for finer-grained policy
decisions: policy checks can, using the "case" construct, return
values other than simply "True".

This means that a policy rule can be written that allows for fine
shades of permissions; for instance, a rule could return the values,
"fulladmin", "projectadmin", or False, and the caller can use these
values to decide whether to allow all modifications, only some
modifications, or no modifications at all.

Change-Id: Id2bbee5c34052692af12e4a028256131ed2747fc
'}, {'created': '2012-10-10 13:45:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for finer-grained policy decisions

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Add support to the new policy language for finer-grained policy
decisions: policy checks can, using the "case" construct, return
values other than simply "True".

This means that a policy rule can be written that allows for fine
shades of permissions; for instance, a rule could return the values,
"fulladmin", "projectadmin", or False, and the caller can use these
values to decide whether to allow all modifications, only some
modifications, or no modifications at all.

Change-Id: Id2bbee5c34052692af12e4a028256131ed2747fc
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for finer-grained policy decisions

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Add support to the new policy language for finer-grained policy
decisions: policy checks can, using the "case" construct, return
values other than simply "True".

This means that a policy rule can be written that allows for fine
shades of permissions; for instance, a rule could return the values,
"fulladmin", "projectadmin", or False, and the caller can use these
values to decide whether to allow all modifications, only some
modifications, or no modifications at all.

Change-Id: Id2bbee5c34052692af12e4a028256131ed2747fc

seconds

commit_message:
Logging indicates when service starts and terminates

Fixes bug 1064070

The patch adds a log entry indication that the service has started. In
addition to this if there is an "exit" statement in the code, then the
log message will indicate that the service has been terminated.

Change-Id: Idb6cff4b85d26331df2c6e14aa0680e82b4e2cd7

"}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-10-10 20:30:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a bit worrisome because it's changing one basic purpose of BufferedHTTPConnection, which is to look and act exactly like HTTPConnection as much as possible.

That aside, auto-utf8-encoding urls and paths seems very dangerous since those really should be utf8 AND url encoded. Also, this patch does not auto-encode header names, just header values.

Anyway, I'd prefer that whoever is using HTTPConnection-like objects behave themselves and not send Unicode, even if that means such code is repeated.

If desired, I suppose I'd be fine with some new AutoEncodingHTTPConnection class that does what this patch is proposing."}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-10-11 12:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Moved to python-swiftclient'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 13:01:58.000000000', 'message': 'Force encoding of unicode strings in BufferedHTTPConnection

When some of the connection params (url, body, headers)
are in unicode, while the others are utf-8 strings,
httplib.py tries to join them:

    "\r\n".join(self._buffer)

Which leads to an UnicodeDecodeError exception. All http content
should be encoded as utf-8 strings.

Related to Horizon's bug/1008940 as python-swiftclient uses
swift.common.BufferedHTTPConnection.

This fix should be probably applied in python-swiftclient too..
In fact - if swiftclient uses BufferedHTTPConnection, everything's fine.
If it uses the default HTTPConnection - then the params should be
encoded there too. But if everything is encoded in swiftclient,
then these changes here are unnecessary, unless another project
is using swift.common.BufferedHTTPConnection...
Actually I'm in a big doubt what is the correct place for this fix..

Change-Id: I938f94cea756be0f4d570d5e465eb8bf8f41e3a9

commit_message:
Force encoding of unicode strings in BufferedHTTPConnection

When some of the connection params (url, body, headers)
are in unicode, while the others are utf-8 strings,
httplib.py tries to join them:

    "\r\n".join(self._buffer)

Which leads to an UnicodeDecodeError exception. All http content
should be encoded as utf-8 strings.

Related to Horizon's bug/1008940 as python-swiftclient uses
swift.common.BufferedHTTPConnection.

This fix should be probably applied in python-swiftclient too..
In fact - if swiftclient uses BufferedHTTPConnection, everything's fine.
If it uses the default HTTPConnection - then the params should be
encoded there too. But if everything is encoded in swiftclient,
then these changes here are unnecessary, unless another project
is using swift.common.BufferedHTTPConnection...
Actually I'm in a big doubt what is the correct place for this fix..

Change-Id: I938f94cea756be0f4d570d5e465eb8bf8f41e3a9

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-10-03 19:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's a lot of testing infrastructure here, I'm trying to understand how to use it.

Basically my concern is that at some point we end up with a failing test and we don't know if we've actually changed the driver contract in a backwards incompatible way (e.g. remove check_for_export) and it's __really__ broken and needs work on windows driver to fix - or if we just need to update the mocks/tests.  I hope that we're careful not to break existing drivers but if a change _needs_ to be made - I would hope it's obvious that either a) we need to bring in the driver maintainers for collaboration or b) the tests just needs to be updated, no biggie... 

But when I try to peal open these pickled mocks, all I've got is MockProxy boject with a few _values and I'm not sure if they're properties, or functions, or who defines what order they come off in?  This CINDER_GENERATE_TEST_MOCKS is totally mysterious to me - I'm just lost :(

We already do mocking (either manually with monkey patching, stubout or mox, etc.) - and for me (admittedly biased to my own experience) it's clear to see in plain python what's being mocked.  Are _these_ tests just going to be "off limits" or do we need to bite the bullet and require test maintainers to learn _another_ mocking pattern?

I'm fully ready to accept that this testing infrastructure may be the best way to test this driver and I just don't understand it - but coming to it fresh it feels needlessly obfuscated and it make me nervous - if it makes it into trunk I'm _really_ going to need some sort of documentation on how to use and maintain this stuff for my own piece of mind.

I hope you can appreciate where I'm coming from, I'm sure there's a path forward - maybe you can catch me in #openstack-cinder on freenode?

Warm Regards,

-clayg'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-11 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-11 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-10-11 06:45:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Pedro,

I sure you're busy, but hope you can find some time to reopen this review - let me know if you need any help.  I'm going to be disappointed if we can't manage to get a dialogue open and discuss how we can help support.

I was thinking about the this mocking framework a bit more, and I'm starting to glean that maybe you run these tests against a live system, and the proxy objects capture and save the results so they can be replayed?  It seems like a really interesting strategy, there's definitely some benefits to be weighed against the trade-offs... or perhaps I'm completely off-base...

I think more than anything what I was really hoping for was more information.

I hope that we can establish contact - it'll certainly boost confidence that we can count on a responsive partner if we do merge this welcome enhancement into cinder core but have some problems with maintenance down the road!

Warm Regards,

Clay Gerrard
clayg on freenode
clay.gerrard@gmail.com
210.788-9431"}]

commit_message:
Make compute manager use nova-sink for instance_update

This passes almost all the compute tests, and I think it only fails
due to a couple of rpc shenanigans in a few tests.

Change-Id: Icdac4daf111de4f7eb69be41cfa509e065a974e5

commit_message:
Fix zmq consumption from n+1 reactors

Reactors should be stored into an instance
var so that they won't get garbage
collected. Additionally, they should
be started, waited for, and shutdown
with the Connection.

Change-Id: Ie6187af2ddeebedeef1714a8ad35ffa4b5695d73

commit_message:
Use paramiko.AutoAddPolicy for the smoketests.

Updates the Nova smoketests so that we use Paramiko's auto
add ssh key policy. This should help quiet down warnings like
this which we previously got when running the EC2 smoketests
with Nova:

/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/paramiko/client.py:95: UserWarning:
Unknown ssh-rsa host key for 172.20.0.3:
adb1c2f1fe461a35cd01283eac03d6fb

Fixes LP Bug #1064550.

Change-Id: I1611a3f6b54563b6a1d64c4f8e193a636ccb1c69

Thanks for the rebase.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-07 19:24:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So I like this patch a lot, but I'm a little concerned with putting it in this late in the cycle. Is it possible to fix the related bug separately from the whole patch?"}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2012-09-07 20:44:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I'm also increasingly worried about that - there are loads of VM/network combinations that are potentially affected here, and every chance I've added a bug, possibly in a commonly used setup.

I can think of simpler stopgap solutions we could try but they wouldn't fix the whole problem.  Specifically, if I changed the 'legacy()' function in network/model.py, any breakage would probably be limited to a subset of the cases that simply don't work at all at the moment.

(We really need to get rid of the whole 'legacy' mechanism early in the Grizzly cycle - ideally accompanied with a discussion on what VIF drivers are for, since we risk ending up with one driver per network/hypervisor combination.)"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-09-11 20:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with vish. This is pretty late in cycle for such a change.

"We really need to get rid of the whole 'legacy' mechanism early in the Grizzly cycle "
+2

I've been wanting to get rid of this for a while. Maybe sizable enough for a blueprint? If so, I can register and take responsibility for it.'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2012-09-11 20:25:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Vish, Trey, come here and change your minds so this can go into Grizzly, please.'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2012-10-02 16:49:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Just been trying this again on a full Folsom release and it turns out that Dan's patches to add the hybrid OVS/bridge firewalling break comprehensively with it in.

Quite honestly, I don't think this is going anywhere.  The firewalling code in Nova is dedicated to the idea that each vif has precisely one subnet and one IP address.  It's impossible to do meaningful firewalling based on destination address in the case where you have 0 or many subnets and insist that the machine has only a single address.  And the firewalling has other issues, e.g. that all VIFs must be in the same security groups.

I suggest we either bring up a blueprint to consider how to do this properly (including the restructuring of firewalling, ideally making it virtualiser-agnostic), or get together at the summit and design the problem away."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-02 21:34:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

so, you're saying we are stuck with the old libvirt datastructures? Or you're just saying that security groups will not with multiple vifs, regardless of this change? I think we still should update libvirt to use the new network models."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-10 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 15:08:00.000000000', 'message': "Make libvirt use the new network model datastructures

Fixes bug 1039665 for libvirt, caused because a legacy version of a VIF cannot be
created because the legacy format has no way to describe the VIF.

Shortcomings:

LibvirtBridgeDriver has not been converted yet.

A test is broken - one of the white box libvirt tests is passing old-form data
into an internal libvirt function.  This needs correcting.

The code allows DHCP packets in unfirewalled.  The previous code allowed DHCP
packets into a port if the first ipv4 subnet on any port of that VM used DHCP
to assign addresses - we can make this do the same by copying a chunk of code.
However, Note that a. neither the before nor after of this is
entirely 'correct' behaviour and b. XenAPI doesn't not implement DHCP
firewalling in this manner, so backends are inconsistent in their behaviour
here.  I'd like feedback on what to do.

Change-Id: Ib2e2504ab78218e2dcd2f7ff098764b5ffdb1366
"}, {'created': '2012-08-29 15:53:32.000000000', 'message': "Make libvirt use the new network model datastructures

commit_message:
Make libvirt use the new network model datastructures

Fixes bug 1039665 for libvirt, caused because a legacy version of a VIF cannot be
created because the legacy format has no way to describe the VIF.

Change-Id: Ib2e2504ab78218e2dcd2f7ff098764b5ffdb1366

'}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2012-10-08 22:12:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(4 inline comments)

I've got some super minor nit-picky things to say, but I won't hold the patch up. The reason I'm only adding a +1 is because I'm concerned about code like this regarding the future of Nova. What we're saying with patches like this is that Nova is the network orchestrator; it has to know about things that Quantum does implicitly, and I don't really agree with that sentiment. It also defers some pretty expensive calls to Nova to make, and I definitely don't agree with that when it can be helped. In a case like this, the Nova API would end up handling this, and we can be fairly certain that Nova API nodes have enough work to do without getting all ports on an instance for a given tenant and making decisions based on it. 

Like I said, I won't hold this up, but I have long term concerns for the path Quantum is on."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-10-09 10:25:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: (4 inline comments)

I agree that floating IP should be handled directly by Quantum rather than via Nova in the long term solution.
This patch is a transient solution and is originally intended to achieve nova parity in floating IP support (e.g., Horizon always calls Nova's floating IP API).
I am not sure this transient solution should not be merged or not."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-10-09 10:26:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-09 11:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-14 05:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'Proxy floating IP calls to quantum

***** THIS PATCH IS NOT INTENDED FOR FOLSOM *****

Fixes bug 1023169. Also fixes bug 1031119.

In Folsom, floating IP support is moved to Quantum. By this commit floating IP

commit_message:
Proxy floating IP calls to quantum

Fixes bug 1023169. Also fixes bug 1031119.

In Folsom, floating IP support is moved to Quantum. By this commit floating IP
calls to nova are proxied to Quantum and nova command can be used to manage
floating IPs.

pip-requires is also updated and now requires python-quantumclient >=2.1 which
supports floating IP feature in Quantum.

Change-Id: I2c32948a8fe291601216dc62d546da64a8fb8428

commit_message:
ReST API: Use JSON documents for data input

This is more in keeping with how OpenStack resources are manipulated than
the previous implementation, which used WWW Forms encoding.

Change-Id: Iba7a6b83a65637cf999c67ef3f4dea7b3e64100d
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix image update script.

gate-dev script:
 * Use "jenkins" username

image-update script:
 * Fix quoting around puppet class
 * Correctly determine devstack branches
 * Work around bogus mysql package in devstack
 * Update IMAGE_URL parsing logic
 * Delete image server when done
 * Add dry-run option to test local operations without
   launching a server

Change-Id: Ifaabff3544b0d9f0f93c866ae1f8f964decfc1f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-03 23:59:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix kernel in the vm deconfigures IPv6 address

bug 1011134

When using IPv6 an instance sees its own neighbour advertisement,
because of the reflective property of the hairpin mode.

Because of this the trigger-happy duplicate address detection in
the instance's kernel deconfigures the IPv6 address on the interface,
resulting in no IPv6 connectivity.

Approach of this commit is to to add an nwfilter to libvirt which
identifies this particular scenario and filters it.

Change-Id: I28f9b49cee4b2ab6ff591fae4feee623955f845f

commit_message:
handle IPv6 race condition due to hairpin mode

bug 1011134

When using IPv6 an instance sees its own neighbour advertisement,
because of the reflective property of the hairpin mode.

Because of this the trigger-happy duplicate address detection in
the instance's kernel deconfigures the IPv6 address on the interface,
resulting in no IPv6 connectivity.

Approach of this commit is to to add an nwfilter to libvirt which
identifies this particular scenario and filters it.

Change-Id: I28f9b49cee4b2ab6ff591fae4feee623955f845f

Change-Id: I6a0d51a63da8017d375b4c065c4c9079dfca8fe3
'}, {'created': '2012-10-10 00:31:49.000000000', 'message': "Configure and launch Heat REST API.

This is a REST API in the same style as other OpenStack APIs.

This also creates a new endpoint for the REST API which uses the serivce type
'orchestration'. The old endpoint now has the service type 'cloudformation'.

This matches the pattern where the native openstack API gets a generic service
type while the emulated EC2 API gets a specific type (eg, object-store, s3).

There will be breakage for the time period where only one of this change and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14263/ are approved, since keystone will have
the incorrect service type for that period.

Change-Id: I6a0d51a63da8017d375b4c065c4c9079dfca8fe3
"}, {'created': '2012-10-10 00:33:25.000000000', 'message': "Configure and launch Heat REST API.

serivce type 'orchestration'. The old endpoint now has the service
type 'cloudformation'.

This matches the pattern where the native openstack API gets a
generic service type while the emulated EC2 API gets a specific
type (eg, object-store, s3).

There will be breakage for the time period where only one of this
change and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14263/ are approved,
since keystone will have the incorrect service type for that period.

Change-Id: I6a0d51a63da8017d375b4c065c4c9079dfca8fe3

commit_message:
Configure and launch Heat REST API.

This is a REST API in the same style as other OpenStack APIs.

This also creates a new endpoint for the REST API which uses the
serivce type 'orchestration'. The old endpoint now has the service
type 'cloudformation'.

This matches the pattern where the native openstack API gets a
generic service type while the emulated EC2 API gets a specific
type (eg, object-store, s3).

There will be breakage for the time period where only one of this
change and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14263/ are approved,
since keystone will have the incorrect service type for that period.

Change-Id: I6a0d51a63da8017d375b4c065c4c9079dfca8fe3

commit_message:
Add GLANCE_TEST_TMP_DIR environment var for tests.

Adds an optional environement variable called GLANCE_TEST_TMP_DIR
which can be used to control the base temp directory used when
running Glance tests. If unset the default is still '/tmp'.

Change-Id: I70e11cedf4b9e89963413623d1ea3c17b8b80326

commit_message:
Update kernel_id and ramdisk_id while rebuilding instance

While rebuilding an instances if kernel_id and ramdisk_id associated
with new image_ref then update instances table for instance_id
with the new kernel and ramdisk.

Fixes bug 1060925

Change-Id: I07dfdbed8580411adea14fd6c5be1a9569a7a021

[{'created': '2012-10-05 07:02:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reserve_block_device_name while attach volume

The block device name will not be reserved in current implementation
due to missing volume_id in block_device_mapping. This will cause
block_device.instance_block_mapping does not return the ebs device
which should be reserved.

This patch adds the volume_id to block_device_mapping while reserving
block device name and changes the rpcapi to send the volume_id.

Fixes bug 1062033

Change-Id: I8f08b568619fefa99850de0bee7d605749d53b0a
'}, {'created': '2012-10-05 07:56:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix reserve_block_device_name while attach volume

The block device name will not be reserved in current implementation
due to missing volume_id in block_device_mapping. This will cause
block_device.instance_block_mapping does not return the ebs device
which should be reserved.

This patch adds the volume_id to block_device_mapping while reserving
block device name and changes the rpcapi to send the volume_id.

Fixes bug 1062033

Change-Id: I8f08b568619fefa99850de0bee7d605749d53b0a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix reserve_block_device_name while attach volume

The block device name will not be reserved in current implementation
due to missing volume_id in block_device_mapping. This will cause
block_device.instance_block_mapping does not return the ebs device
which should be reserved.

This patch adds the volume_id to block_device_mapping while reserving
block device name and changes the rpcapi to send the volume_id.

Fixes bug 1062033

Change-Id: I8f08b568619fefa99850de0bee7d605749d53b0a

[{'created': '2012-10-10 17:08:30.000000000', 'message': 'Raise if we see incorrect keyword args "condition" or "methods"

Fixes bug 927879

We crawl the AST of the set of modules that make routing calls, looking
for keyword arguments called "condition" (should be "conditions") or
"methods" (should be "method"), and raise if we see any.

Change-Id: I32aa140967b80d83a10db898df28e41189675d77
'}]
commit_message:
Raise if we see incorrect keyword args "condition" or "methods"

Fixes bug 927879

We crawl the AST of the set of modules that make routing calls, looking
for keyword arguments called "condition" (should be "conditions") or
"methods" (should be "method"), and raise if we see any.

Change-Id: I32aa140967b80d83a10db898df28e41189675d77

commit_message:
Error message references incorrect variable

In remove_iscsi_target() for the TgtAdm class, the "Failed to
create iscsi target for volume id:" message references a
variable that doesn't exist -- use the correct variable name.

Fixes bug 1065073.

Change-Id: I55acb0dd2ee368fdc62a0ded6280d7ef7cd8ab7f

commit_message:
Handle ImportError's when quantumclient is missing

Updates tempest/manager.py so that it ignore's ImportError
exceptions when quantumclient is not present.

Not all Tempest tests require a quantumclient so it makes sense not
to require it all the time. If a user tries to run quantum specific
tests they will simply get an error when trying to create the
network client instead should quantumclient not be present.

Change-Id: Iea5476eea91e0d92c3b4728f041a3ce72bb5a320

commit_message:
Fix 'message' is not defined errors.

Updates the Tempest common rest client so that it sets the
'message' variable value in all cases. Previously some exceptions
could slip through and cause 'message' is not defined errors.

Change-Id: I09ec8a311fd60ab3b625f41a8eb4147fe5f777eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-04 15:10:24.000000000', 'message': "Multiprocess respawn functional test fix

In 'test_interrupt_avoids_respawn_storm' the environment variable
'USER' was being used to determine if the glance-api processes had been
spawned correctly. This method doesn't work when running in a fakeroot
environment.  Switch to use the current UID instead which works in
both cases.

Fix for bug 1061637.

Change-Id: I79e36ef02ed2adb1c951222d105d7302f4190f84
"}]
commit_message:
Multiprocess respawn functional test fix

In 'test_interrupt_avoids_respawn_storm' the environment variable
'USER' was being used to determine if the glance-api processes had been
spawned correctly. This method doesn't work when running in a fakeroot
environment.  Switch to use the current UID instead which works in
both cases.

Fix for bug 1061637.

Change-Id: I79e36ef02ed2adb1c951222d105d7302f4190f84

commit_message:
Return proper error messages while associating floating IP

Handled the FloatingIpNotFoundForAddress, NotAuthorized exceptions
raised while associating floating IPs which are not allocated
or allocated to another project.

Fixes bug 1057906

Change-Id: I2d6eba9159b4e855fe615ed4dfa23c388d28c6d0

commit_message:
Clarify trusted_filter conf options

The trusted_filter conf options are vague with names like 'port' and 'server'.
Clarified that options are for the attestation server

* Prepend conf options with 'attestation'
* deprecate old names for Grizzly.

Change-Id: I6ad6c6731343e87e058a9f4e6bb7aa8decf1847a

commit_message:
heat : Add missing calculate_properties to user resource

Adding calculate_properties to user AccessKey resource, or
we get a key error when trying to list resources in stacks
using this resource type

Fixes #194

Change-Id: I905c162dd6bc3557825610f046e6ee8228d5225b
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : Avoid printing credentials to logfile

Avoid printing the AWS secret key to the (world-readable)
engine logfile

Fixes #258

Change-Id: I26d809064c603421c4bbe4a060de5d4776fec4b8
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : only attempt stack update from valid states

Only attempt to update a stack if it is in CREATE_COMPLETE
or UPDATE_COMPLETE state

Fixes #260

Change-Id: If47a628f1602d5d8783b3f0e90fd7e76ccef46ba
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add util for image conversion

blueprint snapshots-for-everyone

Add nova.virt.images.convert_image(source, dest, format)
that converts image to other format using qemu-img convert

Change-Id: I2c92cb31114c42717d0ddd011645dc7c661c82c6

commit_message:
Add util for disk type retrieval

blueprint snapshots-for-everyone

Add libvirt.utils.get_disk_type that retrieves format
for given file. Format can be raw, qcow2, or lvm.

Change-Id: I33898983cfa15db6b2654648ce32f72b6dd920cb

This is needed for data that we don't read from IO directly, since we're
base64-encoding the user data, and this requires ther user data to not
be of the unicode type.

We're being tolerant, as we'll accept user data that is already in a str
object.

Fixes: bug 1049161
Change-Id: I4320670de564c8029c7aef14da2492c6f8752efe
"}]
commit_message:
Encode user data to utf-8 when creating a server

This is needed for data that we don't read from IO directly, since we're
base64-encoding the user data, and this requires ther user data to not
be of the unicode type.

We're being tolerant, as we'll accept user data that is already in a str
object.

Fixes: bug 1049161
Change-Id: I4320670de564c8029c7aef14da2492c6f8752efe

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-10 13:00:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes test_libvirtr spawn_with_network_info test

This patch fixes the LibvirtConnTestCase.test_spawn_with_network_info
test case that was reported as bug 1053572.

The new implementation of the test makes no assumptions about the raised
exceptions, and exercises the LibvirtDriver.spawn method completely.
The test has the network_info faked and the libvirt connection mocked out.

In addition. it also fixes the fake_network.FakeVIFDriver class used in
this test to return a LibvirtConfigGuestInterface instance with fake
values instead of just a dict. Also fixes some docstring inaccuracies
in the nova.libvirt.vif module that may have lead to the FakeVIFDrivers
wrong implementation before.

Fixes bug 1053572

Change-Id: Ie5b69a2269ab099267231329eae21bd308fef835
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes test_libvirtr spawn_with_network_info test

This patch fixes the LibvirtConnTestCase.test_spawn_with_network_info
test case that was reported as bug 1053572.

The new implementation of the test makes no assumptions about the raised
exceptions, and exercises the LibvirtDriver.spawn method completely.
The test has the network_info faked and the libvirt connection mocked out.

In addition. it also fixes the fake_network.FakeVIFDriver class used in
this test to return a LibvirtConfigGuestInterface instance with fake
values instead of just a dict. Also fixes some docstring inaccuracies
in the nova.libvirt.vif module that may have lead to the FakeVIFDrivers
wrong implementation before.

Fixes bug 1053572

Change-Id: Ie5b69a2269ab099267231329eae21bd308fef835

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-10 16:01:07.000000000', 'message': 'ReST API: Fix template validation

Also move the URL to be local to a tenant. This is because keystone will
automatically fill in the tenant id in the endpoint, so all requests will
use this as a base URL.

Change-Id: I3fbd5a7d256426079824f8a26fdcd41eac083146
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ReST API: Fix template validation

Also move the URL to be local to a tenant. This is because keystone will
automatically fill in the tenant id in the endpoint, so all requests will
use this as a base URL.

Change-Id: I3fbd5a7d256426079824f8a26fdcd41eac083146
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-10 14:51:40.000000000', 'message': 'Change endpoint service type from orchestration to cloudformation.

This is required so that the REST API can take over the orchestration service type.

This will break exiting setups until heat-keystone-setup is re-run.

There will be a corresponding update to devstack, which may be out of sync to this one.'}]
commit_message:
Change endpoint service type from orchestration to cloudformation.

This is required so that the REST API can take over the orchestration service type.

This will break exiting setups until heat-keystone-setup is re-run.

There will be a corresponding update to devstack, which may be out of sync to this one.

commit_message:
Some more doc fixes

There was a spurious = at the end of a line in install.rst that made
the TOC go bad.

Updated the link to the new dev mailing list

areas.rst - testing was mentioning a pre-release, changed to first
version.

Reformated (again) the release notes, hoping it will render better.

Updated the ReleaseNotes file to now point to the rst

Change-Id: Iabf03772498094b0b7e1014abb7fa56547feb636

commit_message:
heat : workaround engine error with version code

Work around lack of git sha in vcsversion so we don't get an
engine error if the version dict doesn't contain the sha key

Fixes #259

Change-Id: I25d2cfb008a5a9e0e1a60e7360e58608d2d8e9c0
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 1177, 'date': '2012-10-10 12:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Darren,
Thanks for the submit :)
Still it be good if we modify the volume create part and ship it along with the doc. The idea of doc is even absolute n00b can read the doc/follow steps and get working.'}, {'account_id': 425, 'date': '2012-10-10 12:14:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I understand.  Basically, what I'm saying is that we don't need to create a partition with fdisk first.  We can just create the pv on the base disk /dev/loop2 (which is what the later commands do anyway).

So the fdisk part is literally not needed (I'm not removing it just because it's assumed that the user will know how to do it. I'm removing it because we don't need to actually do it).

Does that make sense?"}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2012-10-10 12:59:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Remove cast_to_network from scheduler.

This patch removes some dead code from the scheduler.  rpc casting to
network hosts has been unused in the scheduler since commit
d328ddcadb24d1b1961bd05a7676bc8f54b6776f.

Change-Id: I0ba49d0e9f7e9476f84b5d389c06b7fc43cf0438

only consume messages if we're not being sent
them directly. Plus, this isn't supposed to
be a fanout consumer. Matchmaking the topic
is the right thing here.

Change-Id: I3b06aeb2c7c7445a26c2f41ba428a9505ed8be71

'}]
commit_message:
Fix logic for zmq matchmaking on reverse sub

The logic here was reversed. We want to
only consume messages if we're not being sent
them directly. Plus, this isn't supposed to
be a fanout consumer. Matchmaking the topic
is the right thing here.

Change-Id: I3b06aeb2c7c7445a26c2f41ba428a9505ed8be71

commit_message:
Add simple os-api extension cli extension

Add a useful extension that will show you what
openstack api extensions are available for usage
and print out the result into a nice little table.

Useful as a example for others to base contrib/
extensions off of.

Example @ http://paste.openstack.org/show/20989/

Change-Id: I5b72f5ea73c00f1c1a0f09f670d744c820e05837

commit_message:
powervm: add polling timeout for LPAR stop command

We need to poll the LPAR state after a stop command is sent to
verify that the LPAR actually stops. Optionally, a timeout
value in seconds can be specified.

Also, fixes power_on and power_off calling the wrong
start/stop functions

bp powervm-compute-enhancements

Change-Id: I9ffd0125c1968e9a656d9456ea3eb85f5db8f1ab

commit_message:
Ensures port is not created when database exception occurs

Fixes bug 1064261

The port creation code did not correctly treat a database error. That is,
if there was an exception the port would be created and an error returned
to the client.

Change-Id: I6cf36d1c641b46716afb16f228b8daa631099a5d

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent arguments/IPs in verify install

fixes bug 1061232

A number of issues were outline in the bug report, such as the use
of depreceated '_' joiners in arguments for glance, and inconsistent
IP address examples in the verifying installation doc.

This patch fixes those and updates other areas using the old '_'
syntax

Change-Id: I61850200c98de622fa54bce04859321a7e711e92

commit_message:
Add disable_fallocate option to swift docs

fixes bug 1049996

The disable_fallocate option was introduce in recent swift patch.
This adds it to the docs.

db_preallocate was missing from object and container server, this
adds this option too

Change-Id: I6adc80a6fb6e3b12894136f6bab846c4c47420c2

commit_message:
Add util for LVM LV info extraction

blueprint snapshots-for-everyone

Add nova.virt.libvirt.utils.logical_volume_info(path) function
that extracts logical volume info using given LV path.

Change-Id: I09cecbbd54b292b2247fdf66141c0857cba2933c

to use the 'global' statement.  This removes an unnecessary 'global'
statement from the register() function/decorator.

Change-Id: I0d4388f28acf3c9dc5969d86d74f384f1f3d0474
"}]
commit_message:
Remove an unneeded 'global'

If we're not changing the value of a global variable, there's no need
to use the 'global' statement.  This removes an unnecessary 'global'
statement from the register() function/decorator.

Change-Id: I0d4388f28acf3c9dc5969d86d74f384f1f3d0474

commit_message:
Use glance stable/essex rather than master

The pip-requires file should explicitly install stable/essex
glance rather than master. The dependency on glance's client is
broken if horizon tries to use glance master.

Fixes bug 1057125

Change-Id: I770e5e5e854141200307ddd33b1998000fbe57b5

commit_message:
Add a 'not' operator to the policy langage

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Inverting the sense of a check was not possible with the list-of-lists
syntax, but it clearly makes sense to support it.

Change-Id: Ibd92cd75a279efdafec16a26f9aec33f39614b5c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 20:12:03.000000000', 'message': "Set read_deleted='yes' for instance_id_mappings.

Since the migration that creates the instance_id_mappings does
not populated the 'deleted' column, queries to this table should
not limit results to 'deleted=0'.  Limiting to non-deleted rows
results in duplicate mappings being created for existing instance
mappings after an upgrade, and throws off the entire EC2 instance
ID to UUID mapping.

Fixes LP: #1061166

Change-Id: I8893954fcae94a71dcc284c1b3b23b53901437eb
(cherry picked from commit 1d0402cf65458c941639f01334a996c11e592018)
"}]
commit_message:
Set read_deleted='yes' for instance_id_mappings.

Since the migration that creates the instance_id_mappings does
not populated the 'deleted' column, queries to this table should
not limit results to 'deleted=0'.  Limiting to non-deleted rows
results in duplicate mappings being created for existing instance
mappings after an upgrade, and throws off the entire EC2 instance
ID to UUID mapping.

Fixes LP: #1061166

Change-Id: I8893954fcae94a71dcc284c1b3b23b53901437eb
(cherry picked from commit 1d0402cf65458c941639f01334a996c11e592018)

commit_message:
Add a new policy language

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Add a new policy language with "and" and "or" operators to replace
the old list-of-lists syntax. New '@' and '!' operators are also added.

This new language will enable us add more advanced features than the
old syntax would have allowed.

Backwards compat support for the old list-of-list syntax is retained.

Change-Id: I872cb6abf6f8051c3ff502a0fc7590cff4f63a25

as check types.

'}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

It's tough for me to get a full sense of where you're going for the patch series, probably because of the way I actually developed this; I literally started from scratch, implementing all the pieces, then branched and moved my new policy code over the old.  I really only referenced the old code to ensure I was implementing the list-of-lists syntax and the backwards-compat interfaces correctly.

I also have to say I'm not sure I see the full value of splitting this up; so far as I know, only nova, glance, and quantum use the policy stuff, and I'm already working on a patch to nova to make it use the new engine; once I'm done with that, I plan on doing the same thing for glance and for quantum.  We can discuss this off-line if you like, and see if we come to some sort of agreement…

I do like your idea of simply dropping the backwards-compat API interfaces, especially given that I'm already working on nova conversion to move away from them.  One thing I noticed is that my previous interface deprecation didn't result in deprecated interface usage in nova being discovered; the HttpBrain was used all over the place in the unit tests.  If we simply drop the backwards-compat interfaces, though, there is the question of what happens next time someone tries to sync a project with the current openstack-common code, but hopefully unit tests would catch that…

In response to your comment on the test suite: It took me a while to figure it out—I was looking for a duplicated test method, but you were referring to a duplicated test class—but I see the error you were referring to; I'll fix that in an upcoming patch.  I won't drop the backwards-compat API yet, pending the rest of our discussion…"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/14122/4/check/gate-openstack-common-python27/648 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

OK, having had some time to really digest what you're doing in the patch series, it makes sense to me, modulo the in-line comments I made regarding the "not" operator and the "!" and "@" checks.  I also have to say I'm waffling on whether to remove the FuncCheck; it's a quicker way of defining a new check than directly subclassing Check, but there is that deprecated "brain" argument I end up passing as "None".  Maybe, if we decide to keep something like this, we could create a decorator that constructs a Check subclass, probably using something like "partial"; then again, maybe that's too complicated :)'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Agreed, we can add the function support later.  And yeah, I'm happy with the breakdown; git review away :)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

This is really excellent work Kevin, kudos

And thanks for putting so much effort into the backwards compat stuff

I really only see one minor issue with the tests, see inline

But I'd like to also remove the backwards compat APIs ASAP (but retain the support for the old rule syntax, of course)

How would you feel about merging the patch as a series like this: https://github.com/markmc/openstack-common/tree/policy-engine-rewrite

The idea is to merge the rewrite first, then remove the deprecated APIs, then add the new syntax and, finally, add the new features

That would give projects more options for moving to this - i.e. they could pull in the changes commit-by-commit which would allow us to bisect regressions back to either the re-write or the new syntax or whatever

Happy to push up that series to gerrit if you like the idea. This review would remain and 3 new reviews would be added

Again, though, nice work!"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Ok, I've pushed a new version of the series - '@' and '!' are in the 'new syntax' patch, 'not' is in its own patch since its a new feature and 'case' is in the final patch

I figured removing FuncCheck made sense since its main purpose is to pass the deprecated brain argument. I guess you can still implement a check with a function by doing:

 @register('key')
 def check_key(match, kind):
     def inner(target, creds):
         return match in creds
     return inner

right?

Ah, I guess that's missing proper __str__() support ...

Still it's probably best to just add function support later and not confuse it with the old-style function support"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If you're happy with the patch series, I'll just run git-review and it'll update this review and add the new reviews. You're still listed as the author, obviously. We'll probably merge it quickly then based on Jason's previous +2"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We can talk more about the patch series offline later, but in the meantime just do:

 $> git fetch git://github.com/markmc/openstack-common.git policy-engine-rewrite
 $> git log origin/master..FETCH_HEAD
 $> git diff HEAD..FETCH_HEAD

You'll see the only difference between FETCH_HEAD and your branch is the removal of the backwards compat code

I'd really like to see it go in as a patch series like this - it makes a lot of sense to me. If you read through the individual commit messages I wrote, I think it gives a much clearer picture to folks what we're doing here - i.e. (1) rewrite implementation details and add new APIs, (2) remove old APIs, (3) add new policy language and (4) add new features to the policy language"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/14122/5/check/gate-openstack-common-merge/791 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/14122/5/check/gate-openstack-common-python27/658 : SUCCESS

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 20:39:38.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite the policy engine from scratch

Complete rewrite of the policy engine, with careful thought given to
backwards-compatibility.  This rewrite, while supporting the old
list-of-lists syntax, has support for a new policy language having
"and", "or", and "not" operators.  In addition, support is available
for finer-grained policy decisions: policy checks can, using the
"case" construct, return values other than simply "True".  This
means that a policy rule can be written that allows for fine shades
of permissions; for instance, a rule could return the values,
"fulladmin", "projectadmin", or False, and the caller can use these
values to decide whether to allow all modifications, only some
modifications, or no modifications at all.

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy.

Change-Id: I2951a0de3751bd2ec868e7a661070fed624e4af2

commit_message:
Rewrite the policy engine from scratch

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Complete rewrite of the policy engine, with careful thought given to
backwards-compatibility.

Policy rules are now represented internally by a tree of Check
objects.

A new API is added for parsing and enforcing rules:

  set_rules(Rules.load_json(data, default_rule=...))
  result = check(rule, target, credentials)
  reset()

The old Brain/enforce API is deprecated and will be removed soon.

A new API is also added for registering new check types:

  @register("key")
  class KeyCheck(Check):
      def __call__(self, target, creds):
          return self.match in creds

Support for using functions as check types is deprecated and will
also be removed soon.

Change-Id: I2951a0de3751bd2ec868e7a661070fed624e4af2

commit_message:
image: add update event, fix ImageServe owner

This adds handling of image.update events and create 2 counters for it:
Image, counting images, and ImageSize, counting images size.
This fixes bug #1056981.

This also fixes ImageServe owner which was set wrongly to user rather than
project, and fixes counter type for ImageServe and ImageDownload to delta.

Change-Id: I2512cdfc37f17c425f49a5e5d6d2e25ccb59a3ca
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

[{'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2012-10-08 19:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-10-08 19:59:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shouldn't there still be a minimum time then?

If for instance, a claim is acquired and then the periodic task runs immediately after that, wouldn't it clear out that claim?"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2012-10-08 20:06:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Great question...The 'host' field must be set on the instance before begin_resource_claim() finishes so that the audit process can freely run immediately after and not clobber the usage values.  Once that 'host' field is set, the audit process will properly include the instance in its calculations when it grabs all the instances via instance_get_all_by_host().  Claims just need to be held until the audit runs.

Once this one goes in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14174/ it will perform correctly.  (This review is kinda dependent on that one, although they can merge separately because 14174 fixes a bug where the 'host' field was getting set inside scheduler anyway.)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-08 20:17:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-08 19:43:04.000000000', 'message': 'Drop claim timeouts from resource tracker

Removed the claim timeouts.  The timeouts are basically irrelevant
since the re-work done here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13182/

Each claim is a marker of an operation consuming resources, valid
until the next invocation of the audit process
update_available_resource(), which does a full reconciliation of all
resource usage values from the DB.

Change-Id: I5cb0dd8903d358272ec223cf73f6eb4c06371a96
'}]
commit_message:
Drop claim timeouts from resource tracker

Removed the claim timeouts.  The timeouts are basically irrelevant
since the re-work done here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13182/

Each claim is a marker of an operation consuming resources, valid
until the next invocation of the audit process
update_available_resource(), which does a full reconciliation of all
resource usage values from the DB.

Change-Id: I5cb0dd8903d358272ec223cf73f6eb4c06371a96

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-03 21:22:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix two edge cases with Range: header

This fixes swob to handle "Range: bytes=-X" where X > len(content); ex.
"Range: bytes=-17" when the object has 10 bytes. Based on the RFC, the
range is satisfiable and all bytes should be returned.

It also fixes "Range: bytes=-0" to be, correctly, not satisfiable.

The relevant RFC is 2616, section 14.35.1.

Change-Id: Ib3dc672e083173eb970c10801283813623f26e0e
'}, {'created': '2012-10-03 21:22:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix two edge cases with Range: header

This fixes swob to handle "Range: bytes=-X" where X > len(content); ex.
"Range: bytes=-17" when the object has 10 bytes. Based on the RFC, the
range is satisfiable and all bytes should be returned.

It also fixes "Range: bytes=-0" to be, correctly, not satisfiable.

The relevant RFC is 2616, section 14.35.1.

Change-Id: Ib3dc672e083173eb970c10801283813623f26e0e
'}, {'created': '2012-10-07 22:54:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix two edge cases with Range: header

This fixes swob to handle "Range: bytes=-X" where X > len(content); ex.
"Range: bytes=-17" when the object has 10 bytes. Based on the RFC, the
range is satisfiable and all bytes should be returned.

It also fixes "Range: bytes=-0" to be, correctly, not satisfiable.  In
addition, this case's response has Content-Length: 0 and has a zero-byte
body.

It also fixes an existing regression in swob for the case
"Range: bytes=100-" for a body of length < 100 (Content-Length was
negative and the body was returned).

The relevant RFC is 2616, section 14.35.1.

Change-Id: Ib3dc672e083173eb970c10801283813623f26e0e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix two edge cases with Range: header

This fixes swob to handle "Range: bytes=-X" where X > len(content); ex.
"Range: bytes=-17" when the object has 10 bytes. Based on the RFC, the
range is satisfiable and all bytes should be returned.

It also fixes "Range: bytes=-0" to be, correctly, not satisfiable.  In
addition, this case's response has Content-Length: 0 and has a zero-byte
body.

It also fixes an existing regression in swob for the case
"Range: bytes=100-" for a body of length < 100 (Content-Length was
negative and the body was returned).

The relevant RFC is 2616, section 14.35.1.

Change-Id: Ib3dc672e083173eb970c10801283813623f26e0e

subject: Rewrite the policy engine from scratch

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 20:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite the policy engine from scratch

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Complete rewrite of the policy engine, with careful thought given to
backwards-compatibility.

Policy rules are now represented internally by a tree of Check
objects.

A new API is added for parsing and enforcing rules:

  set_rules(Rules.load_json(data, default_rule=...))
  result = check(rule, target, credentials)
  reset()

The old Brain/enforce API is deprecated and will be removed soon.

A new API is also added for registering new check types:

  @register("key")
  class KeyCheck(Check):
      def __call__(self, target, creds):
          return self.match in creds

Support for using functions as check types is deprecated and will
also be removed soon.

Change-Id: I2067721e43496007f15fb843922d6e44e9ea9582
'}]
commit_message:
Rewrite the policy engine from scratch

Implements blueprint fine-grained-policy

Complete rewrite of the policy engine, with careful thought given to
backwards-compatibility.

Policy rules are now represented internally by a tree of Check
objects.

A new API is added for parsing and enforcing rules:

  set_rules(Rules.load_json(data, default_rule=...))
  result = check(rule, target, credentials)
  reset()

The old Brain/enforce API is deprecated and will be removed soon.

A new API is also added for registering new check types:

  @register("key")
  class KeyCheck(Check):
      def __call__(self, target, creds):
          return self.match in creds

Support for using functions as check types is deprecated and will
also be removed soon.

Change-Id: I2067721e43496007f15fb843922d6e44e9ea9582

commit_message:
q-admin: add API network to phys-net-connectivity diagram

bug 1062157

Also update text to make it clear that tenant network
address space must be routeable on the network between
the external network and the API network if metadata is being
used.

Change-Id: I33f9465090b6bffbfabfc2564055cb3bcdf6cf28

commit_message:
Ignore instances in the ERROR state.

Fixes bug 1064472.

The compute pollster should not query libvirt for instances
that are ERROR'd out.

Change-Id: I8748694453ba6d9d58dc0555ed996fcd9400ad05

commit_message:
Disable wrap in keystone token-get

* When using PKI tokens need to disable wrap to make output
  machine readable.
* Related to keystoneclient Change-Id
  Ic3dffa773f9b8fc227a8fe7592a3d87e8e22e510

Change-Id: Ifd779cc47d35e14e4428210e41fc82d4ee6664e0

Pete, the internal client isn't used by anything in swift right now.  However, it's used by some projects outside of swift.  And it's available for other projects to use.  Things will work better if this change goes in.

Without the change, code that uses the internal client has to encode unicode strings on each call.  That's kind of clunky, repetitive, and error prone."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-10-09 15:50:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Fix versioning code

Removed cruft from OpenStack common versioning code that was removed.
Added optional git SHA information if module is available. The
intent is to have the additional git revision reported only when FINAL
is set to False.

Change-Id: Iae94b84027e7428cd394726e07845d2bad631586
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
* Add reverse parameter to audit_location_generator.
* Replace ''' in __doc__ in some functions to """ since this type of comment used everywhere.

Change-Id: I31584ec6e3e97db475563ef588ec6dfd49ec7d92

"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-07 22:57:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Doesn't this have some backwards-compatibility/migration issues for existing deployments using keystoneauth, which should be addressed in this patch?

It also seems like something which could more easily (and safely) handled by a documentation change."}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-10-07 23:11:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This patch was enspired by this comment, especially last sentence.

""""
If you need to have a different reseller_prefix to be able to
mix different auth servers you can configure the option
reseller_prefix in your keystoneauth entry like this :

    reseller_prefix = NEWAUTH_

Make sure you have a underscore at the end of your new
reseller_prefix option.
""""'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-10-09 16:22:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Automaticaly add '_' to reseller_prefix in keystoneauth, since tempauth use the same rule.
This needed to not confuse people who wants migrate from tempauth to keystoneauth.

Change-Id: I60bddf23e1dfd6074c3a9776e85b2dcf64ad2cbb

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-09 05:51:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix scheduler hint syntax for multiple values

fixes bug 1061381

As in the bug report, the syntax for scheduler hints with multiple
values presented in the documentation did not work. Instead multiple
--hint arguments need to be used.

Change-Id: I84c9629eb3ed89f12c89778c5c9cf66e286a24cc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scheduler hint syntax for multiple values

fixes bug 1061381

As in the bug report, the syntax for scheduler hints with multiple
values presented in the documentation did not work. Instead multiple
--hint arguments need to be used.

Change-Id: I84c9629eb3ed89f12c89778c5c9cf66e286a24cc

commit_message:
add max/sum project volume and fix tests

Adds api calls to get the max or sum volume for a specific
project.

Moves the logic for deciding when to skip a test that needs the
Mongo map-reduce feature into a new test db module.

Adds TestConnection class to avoid recreating the underlying
Database object when using mim.  This is necessary because
spidermonkey can only create a limited number of instances per
process.

Change-Id: Idefc01978e41ec823533b7dbb164319a916b155c
Signed-off-by: Steven Berler <steven.berler@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
powervm: Add vhost_by_instance_id & chsyscfg

This is a simple lay the foundation kind of patch.
Add implementation for IVMCommand.vhost_by_instance_id
    vhost_by_instance_id will be used by resize, deploy
    delete, & volume attach (future patches)
Add BaseCommand.chsyscfg
    used as part of update_lpar which will be part of
    the resize patch

blueprint powervm-compute-enhancements

Change-Id: I4e95b941add64fc1d973e1998a3fcffb0e89b745

commit_message:
Updated the euca.sh to support the change 1050225

After terminating instance euca-terminate-instances
in euca.sh script looks for the instance id by running
euca-describe-instances and dies if it finds the
instance id for the specfic timeout.But as per the change
1050225 euca-describe-instances also reports the status of
the invalid istances.To support the new change changed the
euca.sh script.

fixes bug 1050225

Change-Id: I5bfa8e0228dbcf4ba2c26d289a17f19d09f4e76e

commit_message:
Consistent whitespace after shell prompts

This makes it a bit easier to accurately copy/paste commands, without
accidentally including the shell prompt itself.

Most examples are already written this way, this change just eliminates
the the inconsistencies.

Change-Id: I29edd767db083ab18acc159e21055f4ce759ea5d

 * rename 'instance' in config opts name/help message to 'volume'

commit_message:
Configuration Options clean up

Small clean up of configuration options including:
 * unused config opts:
   - reclaim_instance_interval
 * rename 'instance' in config opts name/help message to 'volume'
   - 'instance_usage_audit_period' to 'volume_usage_audit_period'
   - help message of 'volume_name_template'

This change also re-generates cinder.conf.sample file.

Change-Id: I3d6c43cf56a5335b4bf768c51d65d76735213431

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-08 23:43:54.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

Change ID I3e2973 broke XenAPI migrations (resizes) as it caused snapshots
of all disks (including swap and ephemeral disks, if enabled) to be sent
over to the destination host.  The destination only expects vhds for the
root disk, named by sequence numbers.  swap and ephemeral disks ended up
with sequence numbers, also, messing up the re-building of the chain on
the destination.

Fixes bug 1064083

Change ID I3e2973 also didn't change the stub of VM.snapshot to
VDI.snapshot, but tests still passed due to the new code ignoring all
exceptions while snapshotting.  Potential issues in
snapshot_attached_here() would also be ignored due to excessive stubbing
in the xenapi migration testing.  This is also addressed here.

Change-Id: I145030f92a75615d056a30cabcb6ca97e34a8b6c
"}, {'created': '2012-10-09 00:03:50.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

commit_message:
XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

Change ID I3e2973 broke XenAPI migrations (resizes) as it caused snapshots
of all disks (including swap and ephemeral disks, if enabled) to be sent
over to the destination host.  The destination only expects vhds for the
root disk, named by sequence numbers.  swap and ephemeral disks ended up
with sequence numbers, also, messing up the re-building of the chain on
the destination.

Fixes bug 1064083

Change ID I3e2973 also didn't change the stub of VM.snapshot to
VDI.snapshot, but tests still passed due to the new code ignoring all
exceptions while snapshotting.  Potential issues in
snapshot_attached_here() would also be ignored due to excessive stubbing
in the xenapi migration testing.  This is also addressed here.

Change-Id: I145030f92a75615d056a30cabcb6ca97e34a8b6c

commit_message:
Loosen anyjson dependency to avoid clash with ceilometer

Ceilometer depends on anyjson 0.3.1, whereas cinder requires
exacly 0.2.4.

The net effect is a devstack with ceilometer installed will
appear to work initially, as ceilometer is sparked up after
cinder. However, if any of the cinder services are subsequently
restarted, they fail with:

  pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: anyjson==0.2.4

By simply allowing the cinder anyjson dependency version to
be greater than as opposed to an exact match, we can avoid
the clash.

Change-Id: I21737a2504705f15dd16e6762b44624678177442

[{'created': '2012-10-08 19:09:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hash-bang directive in nova_create_flavors.sh

The script employs bash-isms, so the directive to use the
Bourne shell causes some predictable failures:

  nova_create_flavors.sh: [[: not found

... etc.

Change-Id: I60f3de55d2ebbfa47d444ec72c07728bbfa38be6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hash-bang directive in nova_create_flavors.sh

The script employs bash-isms, so the directive to use the
Bourne shell causes some predictable failures:

  nova_create_flavors.sh: [[: not found

... etc.

Change-Id: I60f3de55d2ebbfa47d444ec72c07728bbfa38be6

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary set_acl calls

Some calls to store set_acl are made in the v2 api that are not
necessary. In some cases these calls are generating unnecessary database
traffic.

Change-Id: Idd0ada4d36821a699df51c4f628409f03c470301

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-08 15:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid create_stack RPC call timing out on precise

The create_stack RPC call times out on Ubuntu as novaclient
blocks expecting stdin when prompting for a keyring password:

    Please set a password for your new keyring

This probably does not occur on Fedora due to the version or
presence of the python-keyring package differing.

The problem can be avoided by ensuring the no_cache flag is
set on the novaclient.

Change-Id: I3ac9e74571ff837cd07fc3f36ecf706180f4dc46
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid create_stack RPC call timing out on precise

The create_stack RPC call times out on Ubuntu as novaclient
blocks expecting stdin when prompting for a keyring password:

    Please set a password for your new keyring

This probably does not occur on Fedora due to the version or
presence of the python-keyring package differing.

The problem can be avoided by ensuring the no_cache flag is
set on the novaclient.

Change-Id: I3ac9e74571ff837cd07fc3f36ecf706180f4dc46

commit_message:
Move net function in class method and fix instance id

The instance id copied is not the UUID, so it's useless because it does not
help to associate network with instances.

Also, move make_vnic_counter function into a class method since it's not
used anywhere else.

This fixes bug #1063693

Change-Id: I31366d0edaf1f2768a9b7fe349faae2cc5c99e3e
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
network: do not emit counter on exists event, fix resource id

We only emit resource counters like "network.create" when the event is not
something like "network.exists", and we now emit it on the resource itself,
not on 'network'.

This fixes bug #1062949

Change-Id: Id36bc3818107bf7b806096b7aee670d7b18215a4
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Initialize the control_exchange setting

The definition of the control_exchange option
was commented out in openstack.common.rpc because
each application needs to set its own default.
Adding the value here puts ceilometer on the
"ceilometer" exchange, just as the other OpenStack
projects are on their own project-specific exchange.

Change-Id: If420422f0c65f6c579827c59504c936bc7c926a8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2012-10-08 09:39:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the configuration for the nova notifier

The global config object inside the ceilometer copy
of openstack.common.cfg was not being configured,
which meant the RPC code in openstack.common.rpc
was not set up. That lead to an infinite loop
when the notifier was invoked, since it tried
to connect to the message bus over and over and over.
This change forces the configuration object to be
loaded from the ceilometer agent configuration file,
assumed to be in /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer-agent.conf.

Change-Id: I45719ab879ae6163329b6a886dee3e82ed4bc260
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

This change forces the configuration object to be

commit_message:
Fix the configuration for the nova notifier

The global config object inside the ceilometer copy
of openstack.common.cfg was not being configured,
which meant the RPC code in openstack.common.rpc
was not set up. That lead to an infinite loop
when the notifier was invoked, since it tried
to connect to the message bus over and over and over.
This change forces the configuration object to be
loaded from the ceilometer agent configuration file,
assumed to be in /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer-agent.conf.

It also changes the notifier to do that initialization
the first time it is used, rather than when the module
is imported. This prevents the tests from loading the
module and initializing the config object, causing
exceptions in any subsequent code that tries to add
new configuration options.

Also folded into this changeset is a fix to use
the right db method to load the instance. Notification
messages contain the UUID of the object, not the
numerical key from the id column of the table. Therefore,
we need to use db.instance_get_by_uuid() instead of
db.instance_get().

Change-Id: I45719ab879ae6163329b6a886dee3e82ed4bc260
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Make the instance counters use the same type

The version of the counter emitted by the pollster in the
compute agent and the version produced by the notification
handler use a different "type" value. Make them both
gauge.

Change-Id: I40c21b458c2e3bf945b08bbed1ae962c20b15795
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Num instances scheduler filter

Allow for scheduler filtering based on number of instances already assigned to
that host.

FLAGS.max_instances_per_host controls the maximum number of instances allowed
per host.

Change-Id: Id3e8973311ea5ac8db2d9e4e594a5288a9e3f94d

commit_message:
Get token using username/password or token.

Bug: 1002917

Fix token-get api. Authenticate to get valid token, using
username/password or token.

* keystoneclient/v2_0/shell.py
  do_token_get(): Authenticate to get token dict: id & expires.
  If no argument is passed, retain default behavior.

Change-Id: Id53d04d571edf44889b1edff46509d21c1539ba0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-07 04:27:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove extraneous timing messages from volumes.sh

Change: I3bbcc5b9f8a4da2fcdb9f6f70913c2d6bc6e2b9b
added some timing messages around the volume operations in
exercises/volumes.sh.  This was a good idea, but some
useless timing info was added to failed cases, this patch
pulls that back out.  The only parameter used to detect
failure is a timeout, so outputing the time elapses in
these cases is useless.

Change-Id: I609a803a7293aa8a8e3cec186984de59bfe9b409
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extraneous timing messages from volumes.sh

Change: I3bbcc5b9f8a4da2fcdb9f6f70913c2d6bc6e2b9b
added some timing messages around the volume operations in
exercises/volumes.sh.  This was a good idea, but some
useless timing info was added to failed cases, this patch
pulls that back out.  The only parameter used to detect
failure is a timeout, so outputing the time elapses in
these cases is useless.

Change-Id: I609a803a7293aa8a8e3cec186984de59bfe9b409

[{'created': '2012-10-06 02:58:47.000000000', 'message': "Scheduler API clean up and refactor

Unlike Nova scheduler, which has to consider serving compute and volume
scheduling, Cinder scheduler only serves volume scheduling, so there's no
need to keep generic interface 'schedule'.  Instead, 'schedule_create_volume'
is added (if missing) to manager/driver class and chance/simple scheduler
driver implementation.

Also this patch changes the interface between API service and scheduler to
allow more information about volume is passed to scheduler for advanced
scheduling.

Change-Id: If0a8ceeb79ed20c93857eefd6524e2f4cee981d8
"}, {'created': '2012-10-06 08:23:55.000000000', 'message': "Scheduler API clean up and refactor

Unlike Nova scheduler, which has to consider serving compute and volume
scheduling, Cinder scheduler only serves volume scheduling, so there's no
need to keep generic interface 'schedule'.  Instead, 'schedule_create_volume'
is added (if missing) to manager/driver class and chance/simple scheduler
driver implementation.

Also this patch changes the interface between API service and scheduler to
allow more information about volume is passed to scheduler for advanced
scheduling.

Change-Id: If0a8ceeb79ed20c93857eefd6524e2f4cee981d8
"}]
commit_message:
Scheduler API clean up and refactor

Unlike Nova scheduler, which has to consider serving compute and volume
scheduling, Cinder scheduler only serves volume scheduling, so there's no
need to keep generic interface 'schedule'.  Instead, 'schedule_create_volume'
is added (if missing) to manager/driver class and chance/simple scheduler
driver implementation.

Also this patch changes the interface between API service and scheduler to
allow more information about volume is passed to scheduler for advanced
scheduling.

Change-Id: If0a8ceeb79ed20c93857eefd6524e2f4cee981d8

commit_message:
Update vif driver of Ryu plugin

Fixes bug 1059393

This patch allows Ryu plugin to be compatible with Nova Security Groups.

Change-Id: Ief1039f4b73af2e815fed429cd717e64888565c9

commit_message:
Add control_exchange option to common/config.py

Follows the instructions in the openstack/common/rpc/__init__.py and
defines a control_exchange option.

commit_message:
tests/unit/ryu/test_ryu_db: db failure

Fixes bug 1061408

The unit test of test_ryu_db fails when it is specified to run as follows.

$ ./run_tests.sh quantum.tests.unit.ryu.test_ryu_db
RyuDBTest
    test_ofp_server (quantum.tests.unit.ryu.test_ryu_db.RyuDBTest)ERROR

======================================================================
ERROR: test_ofp_server (quantum.tests.unit.ryu.test_ryu_db.RyuDBTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/quantum/tests/unit/ryu/test_ryu_db.py", line 30, in setUp
    options = {"sql_connection": cfg.CONF.DATABASE.sql_connection}
  File "/quantum/openstack/common/cfg.py", line 1039, in __getattr__
    return self._get(name)
  File "/quantum/openstack/common/cfg.py", line 1361, in _get
    value = self._substitute(self._do_get(name, group))
  File "/quantum/openstack/common/cfg.py", line 1377, in _do_get
    info = self._get_opt_info(name, group)
  File "/quantum/openstack/common/cfg.py", line 1470, in _get_opt_info
    raise NoSuchOptError(opt_name, group)
NoSuchOptError: no such option: DATABASE

----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 0.001s

Change-Id: Ie639914c64e6fba10112a58efa7f363615d0c9fd

to do the lookup.

commit_message:
Use the right method to load instances in notifier

The incoming notification message has an instance UUID
value in it, so we need to use instance_get_by_uuid()
to do the lookup.

Change-Id: If6f47fde7da9d9a476c68826a2936be5b2ac3daa
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

At first glance, it sounds like the underlying migration is broken? i.e. it should have done:

  row = instance_id_mappings.insert()
  row.execute({'id': instance_id, 'uuid': uuid, 'deleted': False})

This is also an issue in the 089 migration which adds the volume id mapping

So, why aren't we first fixing the migrations? Otherwise we can never actually use the deleted column

To handle existing deployments in Grizzly, we'd add a new migration which just does sets read_deleted to 0 if it's NULL

To handle existing deployments in Folsom, we could probably just use this patch since we never actually set deleted=True at the moment"}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-10-05 17:54:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Mark-

I was originally going to propose a fix to the migration or an entirely new migration but, after some discussion, chose the path of least resistance. The process of backporting a migration to Folsom seems like a huge PITA compared to this change, especially a migration for data that is not even used at all in Folsom.  I'm happy to attach a migration to this commit, and/or open a bug against grizzy about missing data in the migration, but anyone who might be upgrading from Essex to Folsom in the meantime is going to have a bad time."}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2012-10-05 18:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-04 21:18:49.000000000', 'message': "Set read_deleted='yes' for instance_id_mappings.

Since the migration that creates the instance_id_mappings does
not populated the 'deleted' column, queries to this table should
not limit results to 'deleted=0'.  Limiting to non-deleted rows
results in duplicate mappings being created for existing instance
mappings after an upgrade, and throws off the entire EC2 instance
ID to UUID mapping.

Fixes LP: #1061166

Change-Id: I8893954fcae94a71dcc284c1b3b23b53901437eb
"}]
commit_message:
Set read_deleted='yes' for instance_id_mappings.

Since the migration that creates the instance_id_mappings does
not populated the 'deleted' column, queries to this table should
not limit results to 'deleted=0'.  Limiting to non-deleted rows
results in duplicate mappings being created for existing instance
mappings after an upgrade, and throws off the entire EC2 instance
ID to UUID mapping.

Fixes LP: #1061166

Change-Id: I8893954fcae94a71dcc284c1b3b23b53901437eb
