John, I'll break this patch into smaller pieces, should be ready soon. Then I'll abandon this one.  Stay tuned."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-09-28 17:25:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I know I'm not a regular Cinder contributor, but this patch was interesting to me.

Overall it looks really solid. I'm happy to see it looks like this isn't a backwards-incompatible API change, as well.

My one bit of feedback is that it would be great to see this review (or smaller breakout reviews from it) touch the docs as well with some information on using the new schedulers or even writing your own..."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-10-03 20:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I voiced my opinion regarding breaking it into smaller patches earlier but I would rather have this as is than not at all so....'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-10-04 01:55:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

There's a ton of great work here, thank you!  But I think i found a blocker with the migration.

As long as the get_volume_type_by_name(flags.default_volume_type) is going to error gracefully i don't think it's *critical* that a default type named standard be in the database.  Especially if your deploy has some types in there already.  So in the migration I would suggest it'd be ok to just check if the table is empty before you insert a row for standard.  Obviously if it's empty - this deploy isn't using types and it's _fine_ - and if it's NOT empty - then you have no way to know what they want the default type to be - which is why they have the flag.

That all said, there's tons more stuff here that would need a lot of going through to be sure there's no scary "oh I forgot about that weird edge case" stuff, and even with a bunch of eyes we know were still gunna miss some stuff, so obviously we can also just merge it in and clean stuff up as it comes up too.  But some stuff like switching to the scheduler_rpcapi would be so much easier to get merged as independent patches.  so you know... it'd be great if... blah blah blah... you probably get the idea by now.

Thanks a ton for working on this, sorry it's taken me so long to get you some feedback.  I'll do better.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-10-04 08:44:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Clay, thanks for the feedback.  Indeed, I didn't think of the case when user has already put something into 'volume_types' table. And just so you know, I'm working on breaking this big patch down to smaller pieces. commit_message:
Implement Filter Scheduler

In order to do more sophisticated scheduling (e.g. schedule based on volume
type), filter scheduler is introduced.  Several changes are made to make this
possible:
 - add HostState class to host_manager in order to store volume capabilities
 - add parameter 'request_spec' and 'filter_properties' to volume scheduler
 method 'create_volume' and 'schedule'; modify volume API rpc calls to adapt
 to this change
 - add default volume type: 'standard'
 - define basic set of properties that each volume driver should report
 - implement get_host_stats()/update_host_status() method of iSCSIDriver as an
 example
 - add 'availability_zone', 'capability', 'capacity' filter.
 - add 'create_volume' RPC call to scheduler rpcapi.

Implements bp volume-type-scheduler

Change-Id: I6883e19528bd0fdc990b8c2c2890298369800389

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-06 03:17:13.000000000', 'message': "Implement filter scheduler

In order to do more sophisticated scheduling (e.g. schedule based on volume
type), filter scheduler is introduced. Several changes are made to make this
possible, some of them are borrowed from Nova:

- add HostState class to host_manager in order to store volume capabilities
- implement get_host_stats()/update_host_status() method of iSCSIDriver as an
example of how volume backend driver reports capabilities as well as status
- add scheduler_options.py and 'scheduler_json_config_location' flag to be
allow loading json configuration file for scheduler at run time
- add extra_specs_ops.py to allow operations (string matching, value comparison
etc) on volume_type extra specs
- add least_cost.py and flags for cost functions (and weight) for picking up
target volume backend by weighing the cost of backends pass filters.
- add 'availability_zone', 'capability', 'capacity' filter.
- change scheduler driver flag to 'filter.FilterScheduler'.

Known issue:
* Currently scheduler makes its decision based on the status and capabilities
information reported by volume nodes, and these information is stored in memory
of scheduler process.  By default, volume nodes perioidically report status if
there its status/capabilities changed during the perioid, if (for any reason)
scheduler missed report (fanout) message from volume node, scheduler will ignore
the volume node.  To simply work around this issue, this patch changes
'volume_force_update_capabilities' to true.  More sophisticated way may be
add on table in DB to record status/capabilities of all volume nodes, like Nova
does for compute nodes.

Change-Id: I86eb70c4ca2ddb6fc526542c4cdfc1955ebfffcc
"}]
commit_message:
Implement filter scheduler

In order to do more sophisticated scheduling (e.g. schedule based on volume
type), filter scheduler is introduced. Several changes are made to make this
possible, some of them are borrowed from Nova:

- add HostState class to host_manager in order to store volume capabilities
- implement get_host_stats()/update_host_status() method of iSCSIDriver as an
example of how volume backend driver reports capabilities as well as status
- add scheduler_options.py and 'scheduler_json_config_location' flag to be
allow loading json configuration file for scheduler at run time
- add extra_specs_ops.py to allow operations (string matching, value comparison
etc) on volume_type extra specs
- add least_cost.py and flags for cost functions (and weight) for picking up
target volume backend by weighing the cost of backends pass filters.
- add 'availability_zone', 'capability', 'capacity' filter.
- change scheduler driver flag to 'filter.FilterScheduler'.

Known issue:
* Currently scheduler makes its decision based on the status and capabilities
information reported by volume nodes, and these information is stored in memory
of scheduler process.  By default, volume nodes perioidically report status if
there its status/capabilities changed during the perioid, if (for any reason)
scheduler missed report (fanout) message from volume node, scheduler will ignore
the volume node.  To simply work around this issue, this patch changes
'volume_force_update_capabilities' to true.  More sophisticated way may be
add on table in DB to record status/capabilities of all volume nodes, like Nova
does for compute nodes.

Change-Id: I86eb70c4ca2ddb6fc526542c4cdfc1955ebfffcc

commit_message:
Restore manual install documentation

The manual install documentation was accidentally removed when the
devstack instructions were added.  This commit restore these
instructions alongside devstack.
Update the devstack instruction to start the api server.
Create an manual installation section for the API server.

Change-Id: Ib037cfe61b9da5ea72851214d6e905246050f38d

commit_message:
Add capability to set QoS on Cinder Volumes

This change implements IOP based QoS capabilities for thos Cinder
back-ends that support it.  This includes min-iops, max-iops and burst-iops.

Includes OS-API extensions for setting via cinderclient or other tools,
Volume-API, Volume-Manager and Volume-Driver changes as needed.

Associated python-cinderclient changes are also completed and currently
held as WIP at Change-Id: I66d9fdecf7086dc72eea65d65ef1f7c35ed9ad10

Implements cinder portion of blueprint add-qos-capability

Change-Id: Id680fe233b1c0f0b445cd831e095f83c62a0b2dc

clone tempest if enabled

add auto cloning of the tempest tree if it's an enabled service
just reduces one step in getting tempest up in a new environment

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-03 21:11:12.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify http(s) connection instantiation

The endpoint parsing and connection instantiation code was too
complicated and easily broken. This assigns human-readable names to
instance variables and breaks up the parsing into more understandable
chunks.

Fixes bug 1060316.

Change-Id: I5c5236f90d88b9e797cf0a476aabe8cc7cfa1cc9
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify http(s) connection instantiation

The endpoint parsing and connection instantiation code was too
complicated and easily broken. This assigns human-readable names to
instance variables and breaks up the parsing into more understandable
chunks.

Fixes bug 1060316.

Change-Id: I5c5236f90d88b9e797cf0a476aabe8cc7cfa1cc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-04 23:29:03.000000000', 'message': "Refactor list servers negative test and fix remaining gate bugs

test_list_servers_negative had so many issues with it, it's hard
to list them here... but at least the following has been fixed:

* No longer will the test flatly delete all instances the tenant
  and alt tenant have during every test method run (!!)
* Fixtures -- 2 active and 1 deleted server -- are created in the
  class' setUpClass() method instead of having test methods
  constantly re-launch instances -- this reduces the test time
  down about 3 minutes
* Removed all non-negative tests
* Removed all tests that were skipped due to bugs that have been
* Skip the XML create_service() test for Identity Admin tests
  because of the upstream Keystone bug 1061738

This patch also includes patches for bug fixes that Sean Gallagher
contributed but needed to be rebased into this one in order
to get the full gate to pass.

Change-Id: I0b38cf045520d93031c7916dae2479daf69d0411
fixes: LP bug #1059802
fixes: LP bug #1060373
fixes: LP bug #1061740
fixes: LP bug #1061167
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor list servers negative test and fix remaining gate bugs

test_list_servers_negative had so many issues with it, it's hard
to list them here... but at least the following has been fixed:

* No longer will the test flatly delete all instances the tenant
  and alt tenant have during every test method run (!!)
* Fixtures -- 2 active and 1 deleted server -- are created in the
  class' setUpClass() method instead of having test methods
  constantly re-launch instances -- this reduces the test time
  down about 3 minutes
* Removed all non-negative tests
* Removed all tests that were skipped due to bugs that have been
* Skip the XML create_service() test for Identity Admin tests
  because of the upstream Keystone bug 1061738

This patch also includes patches for bug fixes that Sean Gallagher
contributed but needed to be rebased into this one in order
to get the full gate to pass.

Change-Id: I0b38cf045520d93031c7916dae2479daf69d0411
fixes: LP bug #1059802
fixes: LP bug #1060373
fixes: LP bug #1061740
fixes: LP bug #1061167

commit_message:
Centralize sent_meta definition

In _create_image(), we create a properties dictionary to contain the
properties of the image we're creating, then create a sent_meta
dictionary to contain all the other image creation parameters.  This
simplifies the creation of sent_meta to make the logic flow a little
easier to understand.

Fixes bug 1061922.

Change-Id: I9b25a16815f266b0d3f51aee097a0aadc51aad91

commit_message:
Move instance counter into its own pollster

There's no need to emit a counter in a specific pollster doing something
else like CPU polling.

Change-Id: If2adc861be4fec3b414d9688cf36219f6a7b04e8
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-05 00:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'Always use bdm in instance_block_mapping on Xen

It doesn't seem that Xen will set the 'root_device_name' property on
instances.  This is causing instance_block_mapping to return early
without evaluating the bdm before returning the list of device_names
in use.  I'm not sure why instance_block_mapping does this
(optimization?) but on Xen at least it seems that it should not.

Added a check for Xen compute_driver flag in instance_block_mapping to
"guess" the root_device_name (similarlly to what is done in
compute.utils for swap and ephemeral).

fixes bug #1061944

Change-Id: If5b1a2b7377232c78f0629a3624552ecf6ceb0ee
'}]
commit_message:
Always use bdm in instance_block_mapping on Xen

It doesn't seem that Xen will set the 'root_device_name' property on
instances.  This is causing instance_block_mapping to return early
without evaluating the bdm before returning the list of device_names
in use.  I'm not sure why instance_block_mapping does this
(optimization?) but on Xen at least it seems that it should not.

Added a check for Xen compute_driver flag in instance_block_mapping to
"guess" the root_device_name (similarlly to what is done in
compute.utils for swap and ephemeral).

fixes bug #1061944

Change-Id: If5b1a2b7377232c78f0629a3624552ecf6ceb0ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-18 17:13:36.000000000', 'message': "Update nw_info right after IP address allocation

When 'auto_assign_floating_ip' flag is turn on, floating IP is
allocated right after fixed IP, but when there's multiple
instances on that target compute node, nw_info may take very long
time (several minutes to hour depends the # of instances) to get
update since the cache updates one instance's nw_info every 60
seconds.

Fix bug 1052581

Change-Id: I1bdacedb00371d4081c57026b441326c872897da
"}]
commit_message:
Update nw_info right after IP address allocation

When 'auto_assign_floating_ip' flag is turn on, floating IP is
allocated right after fixed IP, but when there's multiple
instances on that target compute node, nw_info may take very long
time (several minutes to hour depends the # of instances) to get
update since the cache updates one instance's nw_info every 60
seconds.

Fix bug 1052581

Change-Id: I1bdacedb00371d4081c57026b441326c872897da

commit_message:
Use policy based rule to define context.is_admin

When creating a context set is_admin based on policy instead of
hard coded requirement for a role named 'admin'.

Fixes: bug# 1053181

Change-Id: I9c05b8ecde887467557c4f01e074145b6a6372aa

So I didn't have the same problem Dan did.  I enabled allow_resize_to_same_host=true, verified the xen host could ssh into itself by it's hostname, and symlinked /var/run/sr-mount/<sr-uuid> to /images.  Then verified resize up and resize down.  Seems to work on a single node setup.

Then I tested resize with volumes attached and the attachment did not get migrated to new the host.  The iscsi-sr->vdi->vbd seemed to stay connected to the original instance (halted) and the volume showed in-use.  When I did the "confirm-resize" the original instance (and the corresponding iscsi-sr->vdi->vbd) was destroyed:

The manager changes are not going to work properly with libvirt.  The whole purpose of passing block_device_mapping in to the migrate_disk_and_power_off and finish_resize is so that the driver can do the disconnect and reconnect. commit_message:
xenapi: Refactor snapshots during resize

Currently, we use VM.snapshot for resize, which fails if we have a
volume attached to the VM, which does not support snapshots. This change
uses VDI.snapshot instead, for all VDIs that are not attached by nova.

Also needed for xenapi: detaching and reattaching volumes during
migrations and reverting of migrations.

Fixes Bug #1028092

Change-Id: I3e2973747135a9c33de194e38537620c397bb87e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-03 21:53:09.000000000', 'message': 'Move snapshot image property inheritance

The xenapi snapshotting code had support for inheriting properties
from the base image of the snapshot (by way of the system metadata
set on the snapshotted instance).  The problem, however, came in the
fact that some image properties were set in nova.compute.api, but
those properties were not excluded from this inheritance logic
except through a configuration option called
"non_inheritable_image_properties".  I had previously updated the
default setting for this option to work around the bugs introduced
by setting image properties in two different locations, but now it
is time for the real fix.

This change moves the inheritance logic into
nova.compute.api:API._create_image.  Note that two properties are
still set through the xenapi snapshotting logic: the "os_type" and
the "auto_disk_config" properties, which are presumed to be xenapi
specific.  The change also alters the inheritance logic to ensure
that the work-around listing of image properties in
non_inheritable_image_properties is no longer necessary; the
default for this configuration option is updated accordingly.

(Note: It will not harm anything to have these image properties
still listed in non_inheritable_image_properties, so configurations
that override this option do not need to be altered.)

Change-Id: I3514da432cc10c75418e1de9752f60640d579136
'}, {'created': '2012-10-04 19:43:14.000000000', 'message': 'Move snapshot image property inheritance

except through a configuration option called
"non_inheritable_image_properties".  I had previously updated the

by setting image properties in two different locations, but now it
is time for the real fix.

This change moves the inheritance logic into
nova.compute.api:API._create_image.  Note that two properties are
still set through the xenapi snapshotting logic: the "os_type" and
the "auto_disk_config" properties, which are presumed to be xenapi
specific.  The change also alters the inheritance logic to ensure

default for this configuration option is updated accordingly.

(Note: It will not harm anything to have these image properties

that override this option do not need to be altered.)

Change-Id: I3514da432cc10c75418e1de9752f60640d579136

default for this configuration option is updated accordingly.

(Note: It will not harm anything to have these image properties
still listed in non_inheritable_image_properties, so configurations
that override this option do not need to be altered.)

Change-Id: I3514da432cc10c75418e1de9752f60640d579136
'}]
commit_message:
Move snapshot image property inheritance

The xenapi snapshotting code had support for inheriting properties
from the base image of the snapshot (by way of the system metadata
set on the snapshotted instance).  The problem, however, came in the
fact that some image properties were set in nova.compute.api, but
those properties were not excluded from this inheritance logic
except through a configuration option called
"non_inheritable_image_properties".  I had previously updated the
default setting for this option to work around the bugs introduced
by setting image properties in two different locations, but now it
is time for the real fix.

This change moves the inheritance logic into
nova.compute.api:API._create_image.  Note that two properties are
still set through the xenapi snapshotting logic: the "os_type" and
the "auto_disk_config" properties, which are presumed to be xenapi
specific.  The change also alters the inheritance logic to ensure
that the work-around listing of image properties in
non_inheritable_image_properties is no longer necessary; the
default for this configuration option is updated accordingly.

(Note: It will not harm anything to have these image properties
still listed in non_inheritable_image_properties, so configurations
that override this option do not need to be altered.)

Change-Id: I3514da432cc10c75418e1de9752f60640d579136

resulting in test failures. Pass server id to BuildErrorException.

commit_message:
Refactor list servers negative test and fix remaining gate bugs

test_list_servers_negative had so many issues with it, it's hard
to list them here... but at least the following has been fixed:

* No longer will the test flatly delete all instances the tenant
  and alt tenant have during every test method run (!!)
* Fixtures -- 2 active and 1 deleted server -- are created in the
  class' setUpClass() method instead of having test methods
  constantly re-launch instances -- this reduces the test time
  down about 3 minutes
* Removed all non-negative tests
* Removed all tests that were skipped due to bugs that have been
  marked Invalid by upstream since they were checking for errors
  that should not be errors
* Skip the XML create_service() test for Identity Admin tests
  because of the upstream Keystone bug 1061738

Change-Id: Ied673e3dd12d31d12979b04e61fd31eaccf97639
fixes: bug #1061740
fixes: bug #1061167

[{'created': '2012-10-04 17:20:00.000000000', 'message': "Fix XML response for return_reservation_id.

The XML serializer for create uses the server template for it's response.
However, when return_reservation_id is set, only a reservation_id is
going to be returned.

To enable the XML response to be serialized the reservation id is now
returned in a server tag/object, as the only field, which also changes
the previous behavior of the JSON response slightly as well.

This commit fixes bug 1061124

Change-Id: Ic74071b1d527c3f3752e296d3fd46a28a99beb76
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Fix XML response for return_reservation_id.

The XML serializer for create uses the server template for it's response.
However, when return_reservation_id is set, only a reservation_id is
going to be returned.

To enable the XML response to be serialized the reservation id is now
returned in a server tag/object.

This commit fixes bug 1061124

Change-Id: Ic74071b1d527c3f3752e296d3fd46a28a99beb76
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Raises Exception on improper Auth Configuration

Addresses bug 1061848.

Basically, this bug comes about from not properly
setting up the auth_system for novaclient. In this
case, an exception of EndPointNotFound is flung.

Change-Id: I12533aefd9d0425dd83e2e4c63f4dd5ff6faae71

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix _cleanup_resize

Undefine domain and unplug vifs in _cleanup_resize if the instance was
migrated to another host.

Fixes bug 1015731

Change-Id: If6eb1ada029d462777bbd6ea113c98c3b801cf5d

commit_message:
Add update to volume and snapshot controllers

Add update method to api.openstack.volume.volumes and snapshots
controllers.  Url mapping automatically routes a PUT on the resource to
the update method.  Implementation closely matches updates to server
resource for the openstack compute api.

e.g.

curl http://localhost:8776/v1/${PROJECT_ID}/volumes/${VOLUME_ID} \
    -H 'x-auth-token: ${AUTH_TOKEN}' \
    -H 'content-type: application/json' \
    -XPUT -d '{"volume": {"display_name": "new-name"}}'

Add volume.api.API.update_snapshot method to avoid making db calls
directly from the SnapshotsController.

Add tests for new methods.

Update return value of test_volume.VolumeTestCase._create_snapshot
to return the whole model like _create_volume

Also enable/add volume.api.cinder.API.update and snapshot_update (requires
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12076/) , incase someone wants run their
volumes endpoint from nova (using the cinder volume.api class) and cinder
concurrently during the migration

Also fix signature on nova.volume-cinder so snapshot-list works when running
nova's volume-api with nova.volume.cinder pointing to a valid cinder endpoint
(presumably recently migrated).

fixes lp bug #1042904

Change-Id: I84f2667f6cc14650e5ce885729d237a2e2bb26ef

[{'created': '2012-10-02 22:01:41.000000000', 'message': 'Add nova-cert service to integrated_helpers

This allows us to do integration tests that need to use nova-cert.
Note that creating a certs for every test seems a bit excessive,

Change-Id: Ia92c1dde8b122aef096004e9aad0a14ee587bbf0

commit_message:
Add nova-cert service to integrated_helpers

This allows us to do integration tests that need to use nova-cert.
Note that creating a certs for every test seems a bit excessive,
so this adds a fake_crypto module to return fake values.

Change-Id: Ia92c1dde8b122aef096004e9aad0a14ee587bbf0

commit_message:
Rename non-public method in sqlalchemy db driver

The can_show_deleted method is only used internally
to the sqlalchemy db api, so rather than make it seem
like part of the public api, prefix it with an underscore.

Change-Id: I0b78c8073471d96f8897f7bec2e2e04d152f0416

commit_message:
Add image_member_update to simple db api

The simple db api didn't have an image_member_update method. This
patch implements that missing method. Additionally, this has a
functional test to ensure image_member_update exists and works
as expected.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity

Change-Id: Iabd310ee55047d625b804b96b537c3c0350e3466

[{'created': '2012-10-03 19:21:05.000000000', 'message': 'powervm: exception handling improvements

PowerVMLPARInstanceNotFound should extend InstanceNotFound so nova
can handle it as an InstanceNotFound when LPARs are missing
Small bug fix so cleanup failing due to LPARs not existing does

Change-Id: I3b26a477e55b4627f401dbb25c66d5e84ab1fa3f
'}]
commit_message:
powervm: exception handling improvements

PowerVMLPARInstanceNotFound should extend InstanceNotFound so nova
can handle it as an InstanceNotFound when LPARs are missing
Small bug fix so cleanup failing due to LPARs not existing does
not cause the delete to fail out, since we had nothing to cleanup

fixes bug #1061173

Change-Id: I3b26a477e55b4627f401dbb25c66d5e84ab1fa3f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-04 07:25:41.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: ignore deleted domain while get block dev

The get_all_block_devices could raise libvirtError if domain was deleted
while listing instances. This will cause LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver to fail
disconnect_volume. This patch ignores the domain that could not be found
to avoid this issue.

Fixes bug 1060836

Change-Id: I9dc994d8ca7fc084830adb4f6f9d3ca10e0fe577
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: ignore deleted domain while get block dev

The get_all_block_devices could raise libvirtError if domain was deleted
while listing instances. This will cause LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver to fail
disconnect_volume. This patch ignores the domain that could not be found
to avoid this issue.

Fixes bug 1060836

Change-Id: I9dc994d8ca7fc084830adb4f6f9d3ca10e0fe577

commit_message:
Updated code to update attach_time of a volume while detaching

While detaching volume from an instance, attach_time of the
volume is not updated. This task updates volume['attach_time']
to NONE at detach_volume.

Also modified the default value of XML attribute
volume['attach_time'] '-' to ''(a 0 length string) to
maintain consistency with existing code.

Fixes bug: 1056122

Change-Id: If56ceda6caab80fb803fcf194ed1dfb18808ec3a

commit_message:
Stop network.api import on network import

The nova.network.__init__.py was importing the network.api
automatically at import time. This was leading to some silly
workarounds (for example in nova/virt/firewall.py) involving
late importing nova.network to stop circular imports.

It is also causing issues with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13007/
because quantum api needs to import a flag from network manager
which is causing a circular import.

This fixes the issue by moving to use the code from volume_api
which only imports the api class when the method is called. It cleans
up the tests that were stubbing out network.API and also removes
the unneeded workarounds.

Change-Id: I4c9b372d078ab4398e797335a8de5e9e1077e31f

commit_message:
Zmq register opts fix in receiver

Following dprince's change to use
FLAGS, rather than cfg.CONF,
zmq_opts needs to be registered explicitly.

Change-Id: I66bc71563435088ee9224fdd603602e35f3e3bff

Cool feature, but does it have to be xen specific?'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-09-20 22:39:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Cool feature, but does it have to be xen specific?

Right now, the Xen virt-driver delegates most of the image-handling to dom0 plugins which actually do the fetching and unbundling of the image.

This was done b/c it gives us a lot of control in how images are handled but comes at the expense of making it darn near imposible to share this code with other virt-drivers.

Long term, I'd love to see us start to decompose the work that these dom0 plugins are doing into more discrete tasks and moving the orchestration of these tasks into the virt-layer. Once that's done, we can begin sharing the orchestration code amongst all of the virt-drivers.

I think that's going to be a pretty big effort so my goal would be to let Xen-users play around with and flush out any bugs, and make the work of making it cross-virt a separate goal."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-21 14:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Cool, thanks for the explanation!'}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2012-09-24 18:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add ability to download images via BitTorrent.

This patch adds a new dom0 plugin which supports downloading images via
BitTorrent. Torrent metadata files are assumed to be served from a
webserver which is specified by the `torrent_base_url` config.

Under the hood, the dom0 plugins calls out to rasterbar's libtorrent via
Python bindings in order perform the initial download as well as the
seeding thereafter.

Implements BP xenserver-bittorrent-images

Change-Id: I824720a6e3a37317080a22cd7405d2a88172c3ef

Hi,
I have been over the code again and did a bit of testing. I have added a few minor comments.
Moving forwards I have a number of concerns regarding the RPC support - the current implementation has the plugin treating agent requests. Will the agents now need to provide a flavor to enable the meta plugin to redirect to the specific plugin. In addition t this if I understand correctly there may be more than one agent running on a host. This could be tricky when managing the interfaces.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2012-10-04 16:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-04 16:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-10-04 16:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: (12 inline comments)

Hi,
I have added in a number of inline comments. I have a number of concerns about the meta plugin agents. I understand that the purpose of these is to read the entries that are only relevant per flavor. My concern is that if there are changes in the log of the agent loops then this may become a problem with this implementation.
I have a few additional concerns which we need to address is the future:
1. merge and support of the RPC code. The may solve the problem mentioned (the agent_id has a prefix that indicates if it is lb or ovs etc)
2. merge and support of the provider networks
Thanks
Gary

commit_message:
Initial implemention of MetaPlugin

This plugin supports multiple plugins at same time. This plugin is for L3 connectivility
between networks which are realized by different plugins. This plugin add new attribute 'flavor:id'.
flavor:id correspond to specific plugin. flavor-plugin mapping could be configureable by plugin_list config.
This plugin also support extensions. We can map extension to plugin by using extension_map config.

Implements blueprint metaplugin

Change-Id: Ia94d2349fb3ce9f121bbd2505324ae6f0c34247a

commit_message:
ip_protocol for ec2 security groups

fix for bug 1057196.
-Enforce restrictions on IP protocol in AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress call.
 This value may only be: 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp', '6', '17' or '1'
-Ensure that ip protocol returned from DescribeSecurityGroups is in lower case,
 in case security group was set improperly in previous versions
-Update EC2APIError in nova/exception.py to remove the HTTP error code from the
 message. The HTTP error code is inserted in nova.api.ec2.faults.Fault. Inserting
 the code in the EC2APIError causes the HTTP code to appear twice in the message
-Update unit tests to expect new error message when invalid protocol is entered.
-Fixing pep8 issues

Change-Id: Iffe0f38abde327288e6a3960a72ad6a273f78aca

commit_message:
Edits to install/deploy guide.

Fix bug 1060536 - removes unofficial .yaml script, rearranges scripted section,
updates curl example in case user used keystone script to populate users/tenants
roles etc.
Fix bug 1060805 - ensuring we use YOUR_GLANCEDB_PASSWORD consistently
Fix bug 1052967 - adds list of dependencies on Ubuntu 12.04
Partial fix for bug 1041703 - updates nova.conf for folsom, not sure if there
are many changes though since our sample install is quite simple

Rebase against master removing curl verification steps for keystone install.

Change-Id: I4e367eb6d2f4787ac01b60bdde2cf68545298093

commit_message:
Pass block_device_info to destroy in revert_resize

Passing block_device_info allows the driver to clean up block
device mappings (detaching) properly on the newly resized instance

commit_message:
Add wrap option to keystone token-get for humans

When using Keystone PKI, a token ID can be over 3200 chars long.
Add optional --wrap option to make 'keystone token-get' human readable

fix bug 1053728

Change-Id: Ic3dffa773f9b8fc227a8fe7592a3d87e8e22e510

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-10-04 10:12:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Upgrading to distribute 0.6.28 alone won't fix the issue. This is because virtualenv bundles distribute... which means that older versions aren't going to work correctly.

The actual requirement here is stems from the interaction between MySQL-python (which explicitly requires distribute 0.6.28) and the version of virtualenv that you have installed.

Long story short I don't think this is a Cinder requirement...  nor does this fix alone actually prevent other developers from hitting dependency issues w/ cinder. A more correct check might be to simply require a more recent virtualenv version."}]

commit_message:
Update distribute version in test requires.

Changes in openstack-infrastructure have upgraded version of distribute.
We should match this to keep things consistent.

CI systems are installing virtualenv>=1.8 which gives distribute
0.6.28, so we'll add that to our test-requires.

Change-Id: I44ad33fd0e96576379ee62a6f584f742e466ce74

commit_message:
Update distribute version to 0.6.28 or greater.

Updates test-requires so that we require distribute 0.6.28 or
greater. Since the most recent version of MySQL-python requires
this version we should probably bump it in Nova's test-requires
as well.

Previously, if you had 0.6.24 installed (due to an old version of
tox, etc) you might get a failure when trying to create a new
tox environment.

Change-Id: Ia27cb7f1e6851eae955e9cf6ec072f4c291afb3f

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This seems to be mostly about marking impl_qpid.Connection and impl_kombu.Connection methods as private

These methods aren't private to the class, though, since they are actually used by amqp.ConnectionContext

In reality, we want to make it clear that these methods shouldn't be used outside of the rpc module

The best way to do that is to make it clear that the impl_qpid.Connection and impl_kombu.Connection classes are implementation details

To that end, I'd (a) underscore prefix  the amqp.ConnectionContext.connection attribute and (b) replace amqp.ConnectionContext.__getattr__ with explicit method chaining to whatever methods we actually consider public"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-04 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Tolerate set_admin_password not implemented.

Allow skipping of password test if this action
is not implemented by the virt driver.

New variable was added to devstack gate in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10215/1

This will allow the following nova patch to be gated:

https://review.openstack.org/10130

Change-Id: I0ebd34c74bd6a4f0a31fb29f38acdbf060c64617

commit_message:
Renames legacy dashboards.

The "Nova" dashboard is now "Project" and the "Syspanel" dashboard
is now "Admin" to match the current real names of the dashboards
which better match their purposes.

Implements blueprint fix-legacy-dashboard-names

Change-Id: I702aa0d54c4e3b0ac10db46e6d6ed32803919b7b

[{'created': '2012-10-03 21:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'Update the architecture diagram

* adds consistency on daemon reprensentation (rectangle)
* remove misleading link between colector and keystone
* refine how central agent and event listener post back event to
  the ceilometer bus
* glance is sending strandard events we collect
* we do not poll quantum
* clarify that swift is not implemented yet

Change-Id: I434db9f7f08150e39c723bc084d28a377ac2b1ce
'}]
commit_message:
Update the architecture diagram

* adds consistency on daemon reprensentation (rectangle)
* remove misleading link between colector and keystone
* refine how central agent and event listener post back event to
  the ceilometer bus
* glance is sending strandard events we collect
* we do not poll quantum
* clarify that swift is not implemented yet

Change-Id: I434db9f7f08150e39c723bc084d28a377ac2b1ce

Not sure why swob breaks that yet; but figured I'd leave a note."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 00:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Work In Progress Thanks for tracking that down, I will try to figure it out.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 00:45:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 01:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-swift-merge/653 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-swift-docs/280 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-swift-pep8/423 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-swift-python26/529 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-swift-python27/530 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/10303 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/283 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 08:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 08:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-swift-merge/660 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-swift-docs/287 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-swift-pep8/430 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-swift-python26/536 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-swift-python27/537 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/10343 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/7/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/323 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-09-05 16:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I'm very much in favor of this refactor! I'm sure a counter would be that using WebOb would get us features/fixes from WebOb "for free" -- however, this just hasn't been the case for the past few years (and quite the opposite). License on swob.py? Is all the code your own, or is some attribution needed? Looks like a lot of docstring work is needed; but I figured you'd left that until you could gauge support for this. Are there any worry areas you know of either in swob itself or the rest of Swift interacting with swob? I see 88% test coverage on swob via test_swob, which is pretty good. Any troublesome tests areas we should look at? For the rest of the code, it looks like just imports were updated; are there any places where this isn't true and you had to update code otherwise (that I might've missed)?'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 21:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-05 21:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (1 inline comment) hehe (inline)'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Added a bunch of docstrings, license header, improved coverage. Should be approaching acceptable on those fronts. The code's all mine, except a little bit around the UTC class that came from python docs. The trickiest parts are Range and Accept parsing and handling. If someone can figure out how to write them in a way that they're more obviously correct, that'd be nice :) Other than reworking a few tests and adding a function to utils, all of the changes outside swob.py should be to imports."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/8/check/gate-swift-merge/668 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/8/check/gate-swift-docs/295 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/8/check/gate-swift-pep8/438 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/8/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/507 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: OOPS I HAVE A POTTY MOUTH'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-05 22:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/9/check/gate-swift-merge/669 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/9/check/gate-swift-docs/296 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/9/check/gate-swift-pep8/439 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/9/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/510 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-06 16:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-06 17:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-swift-merge/683 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-swift-docs/310 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-swift-pep8/453 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-swift-python26/559 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-swift-python27/560 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/10609 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/10/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/590 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-09-06 18:11:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer) I love it.'}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-09-07 08:57:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve (2 inline comments) Wow! Incredible! While I was doing made swift can work with webob 1.2, I thought, it's better not using webob or inventing new one, but it's here, already!! (and functests running faster than webob! :) I like this one, but I have tiny issues which is just tiny comments. IMHO, how about seperate this module apart from swift?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-07 18:43:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this I haven't had a chance to look at this too closely other than to determine that the SmokeStack XenServer test is valid. This test uses Swift as a backend to Glance. It looks like either the upload/delete of images from Swift is failing w/ this branch."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-07 20:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Dan, I see the code in lib/openstack/compute/image.rb which is trying to delete an image. It's getting some non-20x HTTP status from some request. But the exception object only prints "The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation." which doesn't go very far for debugging. Any chance of getting more info from the response printed out? cf. line 67 in https://github.com/rackspace/ruby-openstack-compute/blob/master/lib/openstack/compute/image.rb Stacktrace from SmokeStack logs: Error: test_999_teardown(Torpedo::Compute::Servers) OpenStack::Compute::Exception::ComputeFault: The server has either erred or is incapable of performing the requested operation. /usr/local/share/gems/gems/openstack-compute-1.1.10/lib/openstack/compute/exception.rb:79:in `raise_exception' /usr/local/share/gems/gems/openstack-compute-1.1.10/lib/openstack/compute/image.rb:67:in `delete!' /usr/local/share/gems/gems/torpedo-1.0.17/lib/torpedo/compute/servers.rb:477:in `block in test_999_teardown' /usr/local/share/gems/gems/torpedo-1.0.17/lib/torpedo/compute/servers.rb:476:in `each' /usr/local/share/gems/gems/torpedo-1.0.17/lib/torpedo/compute/servers.rb:476:in `test_999_teardown' 473: end 474: end 475: if CLEAN_UP_IMAGES => 476: @@images.each do |image| 477: assert_equal(true, image.delete!) 478: end 479: end'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-09 01:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: It looks like webob (and thus Swift) does not properly handle a range header like "Range: bytes=-17" when the byte-count of the object is less than the suffix-length (note that the minus sign/dash is not part of suffix-length according to the grammar). RFC2616 14.35.1 states, " If the entity is shorter than the specified suffix-length, the entire entity-body is used." This case also counts as "satisfiable" per the following paragraph. I uploaded a 10-byte object to my SAIO, and then did a GET on it with Range: bytes=-17. I erroneously got a 416 back. (Also odd was that the object-server processes got 3 GETs which all returned 416, and then a 4th GET which returned a 200 with 10 bytes; the proxy-server returned a 416 to the client.) When I patched webob/byterange.py as below, Swift started delivering the correct behavior: two 10-byte 206s from object-servers with a 10-byte 206 delivered to the client by the proxy-server. The gist also includes a diff for a new functional test to cover the behavior. https://gist.github.com/3681877 It seems like pulling webob functionality into Swift would be an excellent opportunity to fix this bug in Swift behavior (no idea if later versions of webob fixed this or not). I think the source of the bug may have been Webob's attempt to handle Range: and Content-Range: (and maybe other stuff) with some common code when the headers actually have differing semantics... but I didn't read the webob code nor the relevant RFC sections (those other than 14.35.1) carefully.'}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-10 19:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 19:15:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Doesn't seem to work Build failed This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me Build successful - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-swift-merge/744 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-swift-docs/371 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-swift-pep8/514 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-swift-python26/620 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-swift-python27/621 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11081 : SUCCESS - http://logs.openstack.org/12186/11/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1062 : SUCCESS '}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-12 14:35:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Micheal, Okay. So I did a bit more digging today and here is what I found: The failure here is occurring when trying to DELETE an image snapshot from Glance. My Glance image is around 256M and I'm running with this set in my Glance API config: swift_store_large_object_chunk_size = 200 What this means is that data is being chunked... or it should be. The swift container for this image (which can't be deleted) looks like this: -bash-4.2# swift list glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d 715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d 715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d-00001 715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d-00002 So everything lines up. As we discussed on IRC the image fails when SmokeStack tries to delete it via Nova's image API. This unfortunately doesn't give us good output. Here is what I see when I try to delete the image container manually: -bash-4.2# swift delete glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d 715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d-00001 715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d-00002 Container DELETE failed: http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_c6b5b534a53d461784eabc384fb16268/glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d 409 Conflict [first 60 chars of response]

Conflict

There was a conflict when trying t ---- Which causes the following output in /var/log/messages: Sep 12 14:22:31 nova1 container-server 127.0.0.1 - - [12/Sep/2012:14:22:31 +0000] "DELETE /3/179757/AUTH_c6b5b534a53d461784eabc384fb16268/glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d" 409 - "tx44c3abdb18924610beb12bce889d3900" "-" "-" 0.0011 Sep 12 14:22:31 nova1 container-server 127.0.0.1 - - [12/Sep/2012:14:22:31 +0000] "DELETE /2/179757/AUTH_c6b5b534a53d461784eabc384fb16268/glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d" 409 - "tx44c3abdb18924610beb12bce889d3900" "-" "-" 0.0012 Sep 12 14:22:31 nova1 container-server 127.0.0.1 - - [12/Sep/2012:14:22:31 +0000] "DELETE /1/179757/AUTH_c6b5b534a53d461784eabc384fb16268/glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d" 409 - "tx44c3abdb18924610beb12bce889d3900" "-" "-" 0.0048 Sep 12 14:22:31 nova1 proxy-server 127.0.0.1 127.0.0.1 12/Sep/2012/14/22/31 DELETE /v1/AUTH_c6b5b534a53d461784eabc384fb16268/glance_715109c1-22d1-4d9e-a333-b9d972cdfd9d HTTP/1.0 409 - - 61aad5140d0e4f41838c15ffed6f5396 - 95 - tx44c3abdb18924610beb12bce889d3900 - 0.0140 - ---- What I've also found is that while doing multiple deletes from Glance all fail if I try to delete it multiple times with swiftclient (/bin/swift on the command line) it fails the first time (see above) but seems to clear the remaining container the second time around. Hope this helps. Again these tests all seem to be passing on Swift master and other upstream Swift reviews as well.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-12 17:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this Dan, I found at least one issue with chunked file support in the swob patch. To help confirm this is the problem in the SmokeStack test's case as well, could you run the test with swift_store_large_object_chunk_size = 300 and see if it passes? Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-09-13 15:09:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Darrel, I created a duplicate SmokeStack config... updated the Glance API configuration in the UI to use swift_store_large_object_chunk_size => '300' (this is a Puppet manifest)... and then rekicked the job. It looks like it failed in the same spot (trying to DELETE the image). Could there be multiple issues here? Dan"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-13 16:26:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Dan, Thanks for running that test. It does sound like there might be two different issues. We'll know more after the chunked-object issue is resolved (easy to replicate w/o glance)."}, {'account_id': 4405, 'date': '2012-09-18 16:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Dan and Darrel, While I've been reproducing this error on my devstack environment, I realized that the option you might change is swift_store_large_object_chunk_size , but swift_store_large_object_size? So, I wonder value of swift_store_large_object_size in SmokeStack and can you run SmokeStack test with sufficient value which doesn't creating chunked objects if the value is smaller than images size? BTW, When I'd tried to delete cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-uec image which size is 25MB in devstack while I set "swift_store_large_object_size = 10", I got error message like this. ''' simple@ubuntu:~/devstack$ glance image-delete b13a7bac-ca0a-4ee7-aec0-9788cfdd48f6 Error communicating with http://172.16.187.130:9292 timed out ''' If I tried to delete via swift, I'm still waiting for the result :( (maybe blocked and timed-out?) For other images, image-delete worked well, so there's definitely problem with chunked object with swob. "}, {'created': '2012-09-28 21:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'local WSGI Request and Response classes

This change replaces WebOb with a mostly compatible local library,
swift.common.swob.  Subtle changes to WebOb's API over the years have been a
huge headache.  Swift doesn't even run on the current version.

There are a few incompatibilities to simplify the implementation/interface:
 * It only implements the header properties we use.  More can be easily added.
 * Casts header values to str on assignment.
 * Response classes ("HTTPNotFound") are no longer subclasses, but partials
   on Response, so things like isinstance no longer work on them.
 * Unlike newer webob versions, will never return unicode objects.

Change-Id: I76617a0903ee2286b25a821b3c935c86ff95233f
'}]
commit_message:
local WSGI Request and Response classes

This change replaces WebOb with a mostly compatible local library,
swift.common.swob.  Subtle changes to WebOb's API over the years have been a
huge headache.  Swift doesn't even run on the current version.

There are a few incompatibilities to simplify the implementation/interface:
 * It only implements the header properties we use.  More can be easily added.
 * Casts header values to str on assignment.
 * Response classes ("HTTPNotFound") are no longer subclasses, but partials
   on Response, so things like isinstance no longer work on them.
 * Unlike newer webob versions, will never return unicode objects.

Change-Id: I76617a0903ee2286b25a821b3c935c86ff95233f

commit_message:
Warn when killing fails with EPERM

Have swift-init warn when the running user doesn't have permissions to
signal processes.  Fixes bug 1017494.

provided the trivial definitions of the arguments disk_format and
container_format. This patch updates the text to display the acceptable
formats.

Change-Id: I0a4f11b34a1f76cda279ec801cede1440c6e5966
"}, {'created': '2012-09-20 02:36:01.000000000', 'message': "Replace builtin hash with MD5 to solve 32/64-bit issues.

commit_message:
Replace builtin hash with MD5 to solve 32/64-bit issues.

It seems that Python's builtin hash returns different
values on 32-bit and 64-bit architectures, so it's
safer to use a well-defined hash like MD5.

bug 1050359

Change-Id: I0a4f11b34a1f76cda279ec801cede1440c6e5966

This code has been unused since cinder was split from nova.  It used to
be used as a safety check during live migration.  The check was removed
recently in nova, since it wasn't being used with Cinder anyway (just
nova-volumes).

An alternative approach would be to expose this from Cinder somehow if
we feel it's important, but until then, there's no reason to keep dead
code around.

Change-Id: I5adfb405c1bd04bcc1ad61d511afb227a198f4ed
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused code: check_for_export.

This code has been unused since cinder was split from nova.  It used to
be used as a safety check during live migration.  The check was removed
recently in nova, since it wasn't being used with Cinder anyway (just
nova-volumes).

An alternative approach would be to expose this from Cinder somehow if
we feel it's important, but until then, there's no reason to keep dead
code around.

Change-Id: I5adfb405c1bd04bcc1ad61d511afb227a198f4ed

commit_message:
Increase default polling interval

The polling interval was set to 60 seconds for testing
and development. This changeset increases it to 600
seconds, which should be more reasonable for production
deployment.

Change-Id: I45d834098194e39bab06fe6e18a2eb72e1e077a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-03 02:27:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ceilometer configuration

Correct the use of NOVA_CONF to find the source file
for the ceilometer configuration files.

Set up notifications and RPC to use the classes from
ceilometer.openstack.common instead of nova.openstack.common.

Run the ceilometer compute agent under "sg libvirtd"
so it has permission to talk to libvirt.

Change-Id: I75b2e563d654f4f89b182e146e54572618f25261
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer configuration

Correct the use of NOVA_CONF to find the source file
for the ceilometer configuration files.

Set up notifications and RPC to use the classes from
ceilometer.openstack.common instead of nova.openstack.common.

Run the ceilometer compute agent under "sg libvirtd"
so it has permission to talk to libvirt.

Change-Id: I75b2e563d654f4f89b182e146e54572618f25261
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Compare lists in api samples against all matches

Lists of dictionaries don't always sort the same way, so rather
than attempting to sort them, just compare each item in the list
against all other copies looking for a match.

This change uncovered a bug in one of the api samples test where
an extra item in the template was being ignored.

Change-Id: I8750560a1760de7f1991563788680b2dac445aaa

commit_message:
Create util for root device path retrieval

blueprint snapshots-for-everyone

Create libvirt.utils.find_disk(virt_dom) function.
This function will retrieve disk path from instance configuration.
Will return path both for file and device backed instance root devices.
Will throw error in case, when device can't be found.

[{'created': '2012-10-03 06:03:03.000000000', 'message': 'Adds self-enable/disable to ceilometer pollster, listener and compute instance plugins. Fixes bug 1021350

This is a first pass at the brief discussion that I had with doug regarding this fix. The basic idea is that the
global config object contains a list for each manager that explicitly states which plugins are enabled and should
be run. This list is the source of truth for plugins that are enabled by default. Each plugin (pollster, listener, etc.)
is then asked to perform a check that will return a boolean signalling whether it should be disabled because of a constraint
that has not been met. At this present time all of the plugins are set to return False so that all explicitly listed
plugins will be enabled and run.

commit_message:
Adds self-enable/disable to ceilometer pollster, listener and compute instance plugins. Fixes bug 1021350

This is a first pass at the brief discussion that I had with doug regarding this fix. The basic idea is that the
global config object contains a list for each manager that explicitly states which plugins are enabled and should
be run. This list is the source of truth for plugins that are enabled by default. Each plugin (pollster, listener, etc.)
is then asked to perform a check that will return a boolean signalling whether it should be disabled because of a constraint
that has not been met. At this present time all of the plugins are set to return False so that all explicitly listed
plugins will be enabled and run.

Change-Id: I25cef42cbde7af15d3c6602999f4606f1e6cff1d

[{'created': '2012-10-02 21:26:46.000000000', 'message': "Remove dependency on python-ldap for tests

We have a fake ldap implementation for testing, but the tests still
fail if ldap isn't installed. This modifies the usage of ldap in
the LdapDNS tests to stub the module before attempting to import
it. This allows us to test without having python-ldap installed.

It removes the unneccessary FakeLdapDNS in favor of using the real
LdapDNS with the module stubbed out. It also removes the dependency
on python-ldap from test-requires.

Change-Id: Ifbe09e16436afa6999dcb7385763492b0026556c
"}, {'created': '2012-10-02 23:02:03.000000000', 'message': "Remove dependency on python-ldap for tests

We have a fake ldap implementation for testing, but the tests still
fail if ldap isn't installed. This modifies the usage of ldap in
the LdapDNS tests to stub the module before attempting to import
it. This allows us to test without having python-ldap installed.

It removes the unneccessary FakeLdapDNS in favor of using the real
LdapDNS with the module stubbed out. It also removes the dependency
on python-ldap from test-requires.

Change-Id: Ifbe09e16436afa6999dcb7385763492b0026556c
"}]
commit_message:
Remove dependency on python-ldap for tests

We have a fake ldap implementation for testing, but the tests still
fail if ldap isn't installed. This modifies the usage of ldap in
the LdapDNS tests to stub the module before attempting to import
it. This allows us to test without having python-ldap installed.

It removes the unneccessary FakeLdapDNS in favor of using the real
LdapDNS with the module stubbed out. It also removes the dependency
on python-ldap from test-requires.

Change-Id: Ifbe09e16436afa6999dcb7385763492b0026556c

subject: Allow underscores in account/user in tempauth via encoding.
messages:
[{'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-10-02 06:19:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

My concern with this patch is that the (human) readability of the tempauth section goes way down. There's no way to cat the config and check what user is what. Likewise, it gets much harder to make quick edits by hand.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-02 06:05:10.000000000', 'message': 'Allow underscores in account/user in tempauth via encoding.

This patch introduces a new user format to tempauth which starts with
"user64_" and in which the account and user are base64 encoded (sans
padding equal signs):

user64_<account_b64>_<user_b64> = <key> [group] [group] [...] [storage_url]

This allows unambiguous parsing and adds the ability to have a user or
account name containing underscores.

The handling of tempauth configuration is fully backward compatible and
this only adds new, optional functionality.

Also beefed up unit tests to get full coverage of the user parsing code
in tempauth's __init__().

Change-Id: Id06304934ab8055a28921f2e1aa3c58a2036d8f8

commit_message:
Allow underscores in account/user in tempauth via encoding.

This patch introduces a new user format to tempauth which starts with
"user64_" and in which the account and user are base64 encoded (sans
padding equal signs):

user64_<account_b64>_<user_b64> = <key> [group] [group] [...] [storage_url]

This allows unambiguous parsing and adds the ability to have a user or
account name containing underscores.

The handling of tempauth configuration is fully backward compatible and
this only adds new, optional functionality.

Also beefed up unit tests to get full coverage of the user parsing code
in tempauth's __init__().

Change-Id: Id06304934ab8055a28921f2e1aa3c58a2036d8f8

commit_message:
Do not hardcode mysql service name when we have a variable for it

This is useful in case a different service name will be used (when
porting to another distribution, for instance).

Change-Id: I5b66ada02f3c4424384c728f1dadb4872bf4d490

commit_message:
image_member_* db functions return dicts

The image_member_* functions now return dictionaries when responding
to public function calls. The 'deleted' and 'delted_at' properties are
no longer returned from the API layer as they are implementation
details of the sqlalchemy API.

Hi,
This seems link something that is very inefficient. I am not sure how often the job is intended to be run.
Why not use something like the l3 agent implementation that reads the initail network, subnet and port configuration, then you are able to listen to the notifications and update according to the delta's.
It may also be worthwhile thinking about having a field that indicates if there is a network/subnet/port change and then one can access one of the above...
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Gary,

This not meant to be efficient, this is more or less the same mechanism used by nova with "compute.instance.exists" event as far as I know that we are using with ceilometer.

And we do already use other notifications (create, delete and update), but we need this also.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

This seems reasonable in terms of a fix that minimizes changes elsewhere.  We'll see if that's enough to convince the stable-maint team :)"}, {'account_id': 595, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Hi,
Thanks for the clarifications. My only concern is that when this operation happens there will be a considerable load on the database - for example when there are hundreds of networks with thousands of ports.
It may be worth considering using the network loop to notify the specific ports and subnets on the network.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We do want, eventually, to move this into a quantum service (maybe during Grizzly, depending on the discussions at the summit). However, since Folsom has been released we thought a standalone program would be easier to backport to be packaged in a stable Folsom release in the short term. I am confident that MySQL can handle these simple queries without straining, even for a large amount of data.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

garyk: Ceilometer uses a continuous stream of auditing events like this to know what resources still exist and what their metadata settings are over time. The create/update/delete events are not sufficient, because if we miss any of them we do not have enough data to meter properly (in the simplest case, if we miss the create event we won't start metering and if we miss the delete event we won't stop). A continuous event stream means that the monitors in ceilometer are less sensitive to data loss, restarting, and the sequence of starting the daemons (we may miss a few minutes, but are less likely to miss the entire lifetime of the resource). 

Having a longer event sequence also greatly simplifies the work in the ceilometer API server for answering questions about resources at different granularities of time because we don't have to interpolate (or extrapolate).

As far as the frequency this should run, that will depend on the deployer. Similar auditing tools for nova and cinder have a configurable period. I believe the default is to run every 10 minutes."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 18:54:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

commit_message:
Add quantum-usage-audit

This adds a program aiming to send "$resource.exists" notifications regularly
via a cronjob. We will use this in Ceilometer to meter resources usage.

Change-Id: I718c67bfb54b74afb3af262bb08cbfd71531188a
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-02 17:56:44.000000000', 'message': "Make resource tracker uses faster DB query

Fixes bug 1060363

db.instance_get_all_by_filters() uses a regex when filtering on host,
which will do a full table scan. A regex isn't needed and instead,
db.instance_get_all_by_host() can be used which does not impact the
performance so much.

Change-Id: I812e1d5320763e5c65232351e1e21285e04e6a4b
"}]
commit_message:
Make resource tracker uses faster DB query

Fixes bug 1060363

db.instance_get_all_by_filters() uses a regex when filtering on host,
which will do a full table scan. A regex isn't needed and instead,
db.instance_get_all_by_host() can be used which does not impact the
performance so much.

Change-Id: I812e1d5320763e5c65232351e1e21285e04e6a4b

commit_message:
Add TestCase.stub_module to make stubbing modules easier

Previously various test cases would modify sys.modules directly,
duplicating code unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I09d333d6daf527e34db0262b28edcb0323cb2855

Sure, sorry I forgot to do so. :)'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Julien: Two issues with the current patch:

-Mutable (like {} or []) default arguments for optional parameters are a bad idea.  See the following link for why: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1132941/least-astonishment-in-python-the-mutable-default-argument

-There is no good reason why this change has to touch so much code.  As per the bug, fix _filter_nets_l3 is the problem and the logical fix is the following (plus a test to prevent regressions):

-vals = filters.get('router:external', [])
+vals = filters and filters.get('router:external', []) or []"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

A minor quibble on the test name (inline), but otherwise looks good."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks good, thank you for catching this!

As an aside, it would be helpful in future reviews if you would respond to comments inline (i.e. 'Done' if the comment was addressed in the latest patch or an explanation for why you chose not to address it)."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Julien-

Two things:
1) Can you file a bug in Launchpad?

2) Changing the default filters value in the subclasses requires that the default value be changed in the super class in db_base_plugin_v2.py.  The problem with changing only the get_networks default value is that the method is a resource specific wrapper around _get_collection()which defaults to filters=None for other resources.  Changing the default will require a few other folks chine in on the API change.  

We might want to consider a short term quick fix and make _filter_nets_l3() tolerant of None to allow time for a larger discussion of whether None or {} is the correct value."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Fix filters default value in get_networks

With that change, if get_networks() is called without fields set to
something, _filter_nets_l3 fails because it tries to call "filters.get()"
where filters is None.

This fixes bug #1060047

Change-Id: Ia0787e7a278a3562af5409861762f067d71f2cf6
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
remove references to allow_admin_api flag

fixes bug 1054119

As in the bug report, allow_admin_api no longer exists and has been
replaced by a line in policy.json, in which what was effectively
allow_admin_api is enabled by default. So, this patch just removes
the no longer needed references.

Change-Id: I1951332d46696c3a832bdc401c5e343e5a27854c

commit_message:
l3_nat_agent was renamed to l3_agent
and this was missed.

This broke quantum-l3-agent when setup.py was
used to install but  did not affect package installs.

This change fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I820d26fba5d2774262577ed4fbae81dc7362e93e

'}, {'account_id': 595, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Indeed I meant creating a new queue each time, but I don't think it's a good idea to create a huge amount of queue too.

In the end I think I'd go with your change and push up sending meters information directly from services in the long-term, removing notifications usage in the long term."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Reading openstack.common.rpc code, I think this is due to the fact we use the same queue for all our subscriptions. Build a dynamic queue for each subscription would probably fix this, but I don't know if it's a good AMQP practice to do so.

Somehow I think the o.c.rpc layer is actually badly written for our purpose. :(

In this change what bother me is just that if e.g. an image.send notifications is seen on the quantum exchange, it will be given to the glance notification handler whereas it didn't ask for quantum exchange.
Ok, I admit this is not likely to happen, but just to say."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think I get what you're saying about receiving messages from the "wrong" exchange, but I'm not sure that would ever happen. If it did happen in practice, we would *still* filter on event type, which is really the important parameter for our subscriptions. We just need to know about exchanges because notifications are broken (http://summit.openstack.org/cfp/details/117).

When you suggest using a "dynamic queue" do you mean there is a way to not specify the queue name, or that I should make up a different queue name for each subscription? If the latter, I would worry about creating lots of queues and then either reusing them or not cleaning them up if the service restarts.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2012-10-02 11:10:05.000000000', 'message': "Fix notification subscription logic

We need to funnel all messages from all exchanges through
the same function to dispatch them to the handlers. If

but that do not all receive all events. The result is

Change-Id: I31daa204c5ee13e8e5f767e0f5e61e2e7eafe624

commit_message:
Fix notification subscription logic

We need to funnel all messages from all exchanges through
the same function to dispatch them to the handlers. If
we don't do that, we have multiple subscribers,
each configured to be interested in different events
but that do not all receive all events. The result is
events being discarded.

Change-Id: I31daa204c5ee13e8e5f767e0f5e61e2e7eafe624
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

Fixes bug 1055413.

ImageType.from_string removed, as it was only used by its test.
Introduced ImageType.get_role, that returns the image's role within the
VM. In case of DISK_* image types, the role is always 'root'. Role
should be the key when accessing the vdis dictionary.

commit_message:
Fix booting a raw image on XenServer

Fixes bug 1055413.

ImageType.from_string removed, as it was only used by its test.
Introduced ImageType.get_role, that returns the image's role within the
VM. In case of DISK_* image types, the role is always 'root'. Role
should be the key when accessing the vdis dictionary.

Change-Id: Ieb952a9246d06a8280510113a98b888237abcc65

commit_message:
Fix quantum notification subscriptions

Correct a problem with the way the notification event_type
names were constructed in get_event_types() and ignore
delete events for now since they do not include the
relevant metadata.

Change-Id: I313727203a215118d3b9faabdd3f7600efb7be32
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-24 06:26:52.000000000', 'message': '	Fix swiftclient 400 error when OS_AUTH_URL is set.

	Description: The swift command tool will set the auth version
        to 2 if OS_AUTH_URL is set even use -V 1 option to set Version
        to 1.So when use nova/glance client and swift client in the
        same shell, and export environment OS_AUTH_URL, it will lead
        swift client to raise 400 error if swift not use keystone
        for auth.
	Fixes bug 1034158

Change-Id: I8003ff2ad4ac25fd710f87c4dab1507f6040ed3d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix swiftclient 400 error when OS_AUTH_URL is set.

	Description: The swift command tool will set the auth version
        to 2 if OS_AUTH_URL is set even use -V 1 option to set Version
        to 1.So when use nova/glance client and swift client in the
        same shell, and export environment OS_AUTH_URL, it will lead
        swift client to raise 400 error if swift not use keystone
        for auth.
	Fixes bug 1034158

Change-Id: I8003ff2ad4ac25fd710f87c4dab1507f6040ed3d

commit_message:
Add option for defaulting volume boot.

This patch adds a config option to default instance boots to use a
volume instead of provisioning locally. If default_volume_boot is
True it a volume will be automatically provisioned to back the root
drive of the instance.

Change-Id: Id4c39e6eeb659d26c5807da3300e4558eab35ea9
