commit_message:
Migrate should respect scheduler hints

1) When a scheduler hint is initially specified, it should be saved
   for later reference.

2) On migration if a scheduler hint was used the proposed
   destination should pass the scheduler filters in the case of a
   previous hint. If the destination does not pass the filter,
   raise a migration error.

Summary:
This patch addresses #1 and #2 by a change to nova.compute.api
to save the scheduler hint, a change to nova.scheduler.driver.py
to add _assert_migration_destination_passes_filter, change to
nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.py to save and load the hints from the
db, the addition of 133_add_instance_scheduler_hints.py for
data base migration and last a change to the test_scheduler.py
test case.

Changed Files:

nova.compute.api
 - Put the scheduler hints in base_options dictionary
   in _create_instnce which is saved.

nova.scheduler.driver.py
- add _assert_migration_destination_passes_filter which
  is called as part of _live_migration_dest_check

nova.db.sqlalchemy.models.py
- in Class Instance add scheduler_hints doing so as a
  hybrid property to save the python dict as Text in
  the database and conversely take the text in the db
  convert and return a python dict type using json

nova/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/
133_add_instance_scheduler_hints.py
- new file to handle change to the database schema to add
  the scheduler_hints column

nova.tests.scheduler.test_scheduler.py
- add return values for db.instance_get_all_by_host so mox
  correctly simulates the addition of
  _assert_migration_destination_passes_filter which calls
  instance_get_all_by_host.

Bug: #1039065
Change-Id: Ic01e47d4484e35f0f4710791c26c8b9367097d03
Signed-off-by: Tom Gall <tom_gall@mac.com>

subject: Not all operation support use_errno argument for python ctypes.CDLL
messages:
[{'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:19:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

1 typo (inline).

On operating systems where it isn't implemented (Solaris?), what are the resulting semantics?  Is the errno present/valid?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-swift-merge/740 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-swift-docs/367 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/510 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-swift-python26/616 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-swift-python27/617 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11069 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1050 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:32:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes I test it on Illumos and after patch that add use_errno=True argument I have OSError exception. So if ctypes.CDLL don't support use_errno we fallback to old code."}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:49:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like you're saying that there exists an OS/Python combination such that:

* Python is version 2.6 or 2.7
* ctypes.cdll(..., use_errno=True) raises OSError w/errno=EINVAL
* ctypes.cdll(...) does not raise OSError

Is that correct, or have I misunderstood? (And if it's correct, could you put the information in a comment so it outlives this Gerrit discussion? Thanks.)"}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-09-10 21:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, it's true"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:10:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Does use_errno work on Python 2.7 on Illumos?

I'm asking because I think this needs a note in the docs; otherwise, Swift admins on Illumos may think they're getting the protection that posix_fallocate() provides, but they won't be."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:17:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I guess the only part of Swift which really cares about errno is regarding the fallocate() call for which Illumos is using posix_fallocate() for anyway.  So maybe it doesn't matter whether errno is actually properly set on Illumos with this patch."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:20:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Darrell: yep, that's correct. I was just confused. Everything should work on Illumos due to the use of posix_fallocate().

Sorry for the confusion."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-swift-merge/742 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-swift-docs/369 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-swift-pep8/512 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-swift-python26/618 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-swift-python27/619 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/11076 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/12737/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/1057 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:31:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The reason for the errno addition is because on Linux version for fallocate sets it on error (and not all errnos are bad). However, posix_fallocate has different semantics (return code vs errno), according to the man pages.

In the case of the *fallocate() calls, the goal is to fast fail if there is no space on the drive. This patch should ensure that the intended behavior in utils.py:fallocate() still happens."}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

removing my -1. misclick'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-10 22:42:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

http://docs.python.org/library/ctypes.html#ctypes.CDLL make no mention of platform-specific restraints on use_errno.

I don't know if the docs are wrong or if there is something different about the Illumos box.

Vito, what do you think?

Also, if this can be patched quickly, we should try to get it backported to the 1.7.0 milestone-proposed branch, IMO."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-09-10 23:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Dunno if this helps or not, but... (from IRC):

the 2.6.8 source for ctypes doesn't seem to have any wonky #ifdefs for anything other than various Windows platforms.  The support for FUNCFLAG_USE_ERRNO appears to always get compiled...

From the makefile for python (http://src.opensolaris.org/source/xref/userland/gate/components/python/python26/Makefile), it looks like it's built with a "system" libffi, so who knows what that does.  There are some ctypes-related patches, but they don't seem relevant: http://src.opensolaris.org/source/xref/userland/gate/components/python/python26/patches/'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-12 00:54:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've got an OpenIndiana file server at home. Duplicating the swift code, this is what I get:

https://gist.github.com/3703341

22 == EINVAL, which is because the underlying filesystem does not support the operation.

In other words, I can get EINVAL, which should probably be caught, but I don't get an OSError where this patch claims to be fixing the error. I think instead EINVAL should be added to line 173 or utils.py (the errno check in fallocate())"}, {'account_id': 2401, 'date': '2012-09-12 11:48:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It seems that ZFS don't support fallocate http://src.illumos.org/source/xref/illumos-gate/usr/src/lib/libc/port/gen/posix_fallocate.c#50 that is why I have OSError exception with errno 22. One of solution can be ignore errno 22 in swift.common.utils.fallocate or rely on configuration parameter disable_fallocate. What solution better?"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-12 14:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think ignoring EINVAL would be better'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-09-12 16:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In order to make a decision today on this getting backported to 1.7.0, I have proposed a patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12885/) to fix this.'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-09-17 19:26:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

I'm pretty sure because of the previous patch already merged that this is no longer needed."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-02 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-02 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Improve Quantum advanced config options.

- L3 agent configs (namespace, multi agent, metadata support)
- Remove keystone auth from DHCP agent configs
- Namespace requirements to the "Limitations" section

Change-Id: I0e5893171b84419aa27bf350ab6e6853a59bc9d7

So I'm a bit conflicted here - what do we want out notifications to represent? These cases aren't system-level errors, but the response to users will be an error. I would argue that these notifications shouldn't exist and we should only notify when something in the system is modified successfully."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-19 07:48:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Brian, that would be fine for me too. In the case of ceilometer, we listen for notifications.info, and we expect that all image.* messages are success, not errors. Therefore this patch. But if you think the error shouldn't be passed on the notification bus, I'm ok, I can change this patch with a removal of all error sent to the bus."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-19 16:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've actually got a blueprint filed that would cover this work - link your patch to glance-notifications-deux. I'd love to see the removal of all error notifications that are really just HTTP 4XX responses and aren't system-level errors."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-20 14:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-20 14:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

happened well, we want this on the error level like it's done for others.

Change-Id: Ic87006889669b1cbff66dd1506da95175897a1dc
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}, {'created': '2012-09-18 12:37:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix notifier level for image update and delete events

We don't want to be notified on the info level for image update or deletion
that didn't happened well, we want this on the error level like it's done
for others.

commit_message:
Remove notifications on error

If an error occured due to a request from a user, don't send any
notifications.

This implements part of blueprint glance-notifications-deux

Change-Id: Ic87006889669b1cbff66dd1506da95175897a1dc
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Alter image_member_[update|delete] to use member id

Rather than expect a full sqlalchemy object, the
image_member_delete and image_member_update functions
now expect a member id.

Change-Id: I0114ac81e3b805c4bcb471ba57f2d7259eef3afe

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-01 18:01:24.000000000', 'message': "remove deprecated connection_type flag

Fixes bug #1025712

connection_type was deprecated in Folsom and should now
be removed in Grizzly as early as possible to shake out
any fallout. This removes all references to it, changes
the config sample and tests appropriately, and changes
the migration which used it's value to do initial fixtures
for flavors.

Change-Id: I8af831600a1931ae92c6d06c5105bd1bd81debe3
"}, {'created': '2012-10-01 19:27:43.000000000', 'message': "remove deprecated connection_type flag

Fixes bug #1025712

connection_type was deprecated in Folsom and should now
be removed in Grizzly as early as possible to shake out
any fallout. This removes all references to it, changes
the config sample and tests appropriately.

Remove old default fixtures for flavors that specify
ephemeral disks if the connection_type flag was set to
'libvirt'

Change-Id: I8af831600a1931ae92c6d06c5105bd1bd81debe3
"}]
commit_message:
remove deprecated connection_type flag

Fixes bug #1025712

connection_type was deprecated in Folsom and should now
be removed in Grizzly as early as possible to shake out
any fallout. This removes all references to it, changes
the config sample and tests appropriately.

Remove old default fixtures for flavors that specify
ephemeral disks if the connection_type flag was set to
'libvirt'

Change-Id: I8af831600a1931ae92c6d06c5105bd1bd81debe3

commit_message:
Remove outdated moduleauthor tags

The moduelauthor tags are used by the docs to see who wrote what.
But many of them are outdated and wrong.

fixes bug 1044578

Change-Id: I9cc27430c906d1418faf28e1b53f6306c62e8f98

commit_message:
updating base keystoneclient documentation

* updated changelog
* described CLI authentication for admin and user
* tweaked API usage docs a bit with formatting and typos

commit_message:
xenapi: Removing legacy swap-in-image.

This patch removes our legacy handling of swap in the image. Now that
we're generating swap on-the-fly, this stop-gap solution can go away.

Change-Id: Ied3198f77af8dabb6cfbf2ab9cfb3a4eb18e32ea

commit_message:
Catch NotFound exception in FloatingIP add/remove

Catch the FloatingIPNotFoundForAddress exception for add/remove
operations in floating ip extension for non existing floating ips.

Fixes bug 977536

Change-Id: Ied450aa56ef7a52a015c6d78a099d445ab6258b6

commit_message:
updating keystoneclient doc theme

adding in openstack theming
enabling last update from git
removing old manual references to API, converted entirely to autodoc
updated .gitignore
fixed docstring warnings and errors

Change-Id: Id22ddc446331d52cbf56c3462d8b532fc37f64ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-01 17:13:41.000000000', 'message': "Remove TestCase.assertNotRaises

assertNotRaises appears to have been added to provide an easier way to
assert that an exception should not be raised by a particular call in
the test.

However, the implementation has a couple of problems.

The first is that it catches every other exception than the one specified,
and silently ignores them. This had lead to one bug where a legitimate bug
in the test (test_exception_with_rescheduling_enabled) was silently
ignored. The call intended to be tested was called with too few
arguments and the resulting TypeError was silently ignored.

The second is that assertNotRaises could be called with None, which
meant that no exceptions should be raised. However, this didn't do
anything other than reraise the original exception. Calling
assertNotRaises just adds an extra call with no value.

From a design stand point, it's not clear what value this assertion
provides since the test runner will already fail a test if an exception
is raised.

Change-Id: I64502dfa0e873f2bbd9b733a5fb63023e1b4e296
"}]
commit_message:
Remove TestCase.assertNotRaises

assertNotRaises appears to have been added to provide an easier way to
assert that an exception should not be raised by a particular call in
the test.

However, the implementation has a couple of problems.

The first is that it catches every other exception than the one specified,
and silently ignores them. This had lead to one bug where a legitimate bug
in the test (test_exception_with_rescheduling_enabled) was silently
ignored. The call intended to be tested was called with too few
arguments and the resulting TypeError was silently ignored.

The second is that assertNotRaises could be called with None, which
meant that no exceptions should be raised. However, this didn't do
anything other than reraise the original exception. Calling
assertNotRaises just adds an extra call with no value.

From a design stand point, it's not clear what value this assertion
provides since the test runner will already fail a test if an exception
is raised.

Change-Id: I64502dfa0e873f2bbd9b733a5fb63023e1b4e296

commit_message:
Sync openstack common and add policy

network_utils.

Fixes: bug #1058353

commit_message:
Add Samuel Merritt's ring file recovery doc

This text from Samuel Merritt (torgomatic) @
https://answers.launchpad.net/swift/+question/208975 details a
proceedure by which ring builder files could be recovered in the
event of their loss. Added it in a new section under troubleshooting.

fixes bug 1054828

Change-Id: Ifdb203dcdf10da83a123cd71bcc7403801a17e5f

commit_message:
document quantum provider network extension

The section on Provider Networks in chapter 5 of the Quantum Admin
Guide is fleshed out for the Folsom release with subsections on
Terminology, Provider Attributes, and Provider API Workflow.

Fixes bug 1057537.

Change-Id: I928124683d10e4abc5862c830ac344704ff8156e

commit_message:
Split meter publishing from the global config obj

The meter signing and publishing code was tightly coupled
to the global configuration object, making it more difficult
to reuse in an outside project. This change adds arguments
for the configuration settings actually being used in
those libraries and moves use of the global configuration
object higher up the stack to the manager. It also organizes
the definition of the options related to signing and
publishing metering messages so they can more easily by
registered on other configuration objects.

Change-Id: I8b1df0f228d0c2658841c4b7f7f4527414efc9a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-01 14:11:14.000000000', 'message': "Rename absolute to gauge

After discussion with people outside of Ceilometer, it seems that absolute
is a confusing name. For example, what we call currently 'delta' is called
'absolute' in RRD.

Using gauge seems to be clearer.

Change-Id: I1b686e34a1294cbdd35cdb84e3ab9c6c78df04dd
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
Rename absolute to gauge

After discussion with people outside of Ceilometer, it seems that absolute
is a confusing name. For example, what we call currently 'delta' is called
'absolute' in RRD.

Using gauge seems to be clearer.

Change-Id: I1b686e34a1294cbdd35cdb84e3ab9c6c78df04dd
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-29 10:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add a note about PV guest req for xen volumes

fixes bug 1057604

As in the bug report: you can only attach a volume to a PV guest if
 using XenServer. Otherwise you get errors from the underlying xapi
plugin, complaining for PV drivers. This patch adds a note.

Change-Id: I533d4ae5f86b5673974776bd482cc84c2cb7b05d
'}, {'created': '2012-10-01 13:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add a note about PV guest req for xen volumes

fixes bug 1057604

As in the bug report: you can only attach a volume to a PV guest if
 using XenServer. Otherwise you get errors from the underlying xapi
plugin, complaining for PV drivers. This patch adds a note.

Patchset just removes tabs.

commit_message:
Add a note about PV guest req for xen volumes

fixes bug 1057604

As in the bug report: you can only attach a volume to a PV guest if
 using XenServer. Otherwise you get errors from the underlying xapi
plugin, complaining for PV drivers. This patch adds a note.

Patchset removes tabs and adds to title of note.

Change-Id: I533d4ae5f86b5673974776bd482cc84c2cb7b05d

commit_message:
Some fixes to the all-in-one Folsom/ubuntu install

Fixes to the all-in-one Folsom/ubuntu install:
* Added create tenants instructions
* Added version to quantum endpoint urls
* Missing "keystone" command when service-list
* For cinder you need to populate db

Change-Id: Ia504763579632416e09678dd19f7d9f9401cb4a3

commit_message:
Rework RPC notification mechanism

We allow plugin to specify clearly which exchange and topic there are
interested in, and we call directly the handler process notification without
looking in a dict to be faster.

Change-Id: I867f0b2568d140bfc0dae63163fd02c8c080d8d1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Add a section on swift-constraints

fixes bug 1054994

Change Ie4588e052fd158314ddca6cd8fca9bc793311465 on Sept 5th 2012
 introduced new functionality to swift that made previous hard-coded
 constants into configuration variables. This patch adds a section
detailing the new options.

Change-Id: I1713d02299ddcd1203c205573934aa1c3d2e8d31

commit_message:
Update keystone commands for user-->user-id

fixes bug 1058431

keystone client arguments --user and --role are now
--user-id and --role-id. This patch updates the examples
in the install guide

commit_message:
Update packaging files

- Update the openstack.common.setup  module
- Update our openstack-common.conf to include setup.py
  in future updates
- Use the common setup command class so the sdist command
  generates an AUTHORS file and ChangeLog

Change-Id: I4469f0feaea5bb67022c6077bbea43110384f31b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-01 08:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Limit pep8 checks to our source

Exclude the .update-env directory, including anything
installed there from third-party packages, when running
pep8.

Change-Id: I2c2ee9146cbf2f5449f7f8d042b578ec3d8d2b83
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-10-01 08:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Limit pep8 checks to our source

Running pep8 against "." causes it to check the .update-env
files, including anything installed there from third-party
packages. We really only need to check the files created
as part of the common library.

Change-Id: I2c2ee9146cbf2f5449f7f8d042b578ec3d8d2b83
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Limit pep8 checks to our source

Exclude the .update-env directory, including anything
installed there from third-party packages, when running
pep8.

Change-Id: I2c2ee9146cbf2f5449f7f8d042b578ec3d8d2b83
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Use self.flags() instead of manipulating FLAGS by hand

Since these test cases subclass test.TestCase, they can use self.flags()
to temporarily mutate FLAGS and have it cleaned automatically in the
tearDown() method provided by test.TestCase

Change-Id: I70ec3f8c947172816415190908d8a650d87d7b92

commit_message:
Use test.TestCase provided self.mox and self.stubs

Since these test cases subclass test.TestCase, it's unnecessary to
create a new self._mox when self.mox already exists. Also, self.stubs
already exists. Finally, it's unnecessary to call VerifyAll() since
test.TestCase does that as well.

Change-Id: Ib5a176d9d3448f3eb86d13ca6199d1ea557480d0

  * NOTE: This is a port from cinder to nova volumes
  * Now to view all volumes or volume snapshots across
    all tenants you need to include the all_tenants=1
    GET param in your api request.
  * Fixes remaining issues blocking bug #967882

Change-Id: I1a2e8b7aea06df7f66828b9f92217bee714808f1
(cherry picked from commit 8077486b3c15012f4dbf270cd8c9fa3f48cb3d36)

commit_message:
Default behavior should restrict admins to tenant for volumes.

  * NOTE: This is a port from cinder to nova volumes
  * Now to view all volumes or volume snapshots across
    all tenants you need to include the all_tenants=1
    GET param in your api request.
  * Fixes remaining issues blocking bug #967882

Change-Id: I1a2e8b7aea06df7f66828b9f92217bee714808f1
(cherry picked from commit 8077486b3c15012f4dbf270cd8c9fa3f48cb3d36)

commit_message:
add string parameter length checking for v2 API

Fixes bug 1044129

Currently quantum V2 API will not check string parameter length.
So, if the string parameter is too long, quantum will store part
of the string. I add basic length checking for string parameter
in this patch.

Change-Id: Ieed58e1f0ca78ade89b80f01b0ba104f92f05f70

commit_message:
xenapi: implement resume_state_on_host_boot

Implement the resume_state_on_host_boot() driver method for XenAPI.
This makes it possible to automatically start instances when
nova-compute starts up with the XenAPI driver.

Change-Id: I68eb11fae57825898009aa1d9567d8112aad53b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-28 21:50:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary setUp, tearDown and __init__ in tests

These methods simply call the same parent class method with the same
arguments. This is the default behavior of Python and re-implementing
that is unnecessary.

Change-Id: I29503f6c5442e2aae645899dc157466e6201ba75
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp, tearDown and __init__ in tests

These methods simply call the same parent class method with the same
arguments. This is the default behavior of Python and re-implementing
that is unnecessary.

Change-Id: I29503f6c5442e2aae645899dc157466e6201ba75

commit_message:
libvirt: continue detach if instance not found

Currently the libvirt code will always logout of the iscsi target
during detach error, but the exception will cause the volume to
remain in an attached state. This needs to be more consistent, so
This patch checks specifically for not found and logs a warning
and explicitly detaches. Any other exception will leave iscsi
logged in and leave the volume in the attached state.

Fixes bug 1057756

Change-Id: I23bb7f27e8a9b20fdbf62b0629ca8cc448f427c5

[{'created': '2012-09-25 15:25:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix XenServer's ability to boot xen type images

Fixes bug 1055431.

As the scheduler wants to boot a vm_mode=xen type of image, the host's
"supported_instances" capability is used for finding a good candidate.
In the Xapi case, this field was not populated.

This fix modifies the xapi xenhost plugin, so the Xen host capabilities
are returned back to the compute node, as "host_capabilities".
On the compute side, the mentioned information is used, to extract the
"supported_instances" information.

Change-Id: I2da11ab81f74b5b52e2c30832a694470978e21b0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix XenServer's ability to boot xen type images

Fixes bug 1055431.

As the scheduler wants to boot a vm_mode=xen type of image, the host's
"supported_instances" capability is used for finding a good candidate.
In the Xapi case, this field was not populated.

This fix modifies the xapi xenhost plugin, so the Xen host capabilities
are returned back to the compute node, as "host_capabilities".
On the compute side, the mentioned information is used, to extract the
"supported_instances" information.

Change-Id: I2da11ab81f74b5b52e2c30832a694470978e21b0

commit_message:
all_extensions api_samples testing for server actions

server actions sometimes return servers objects, which means
their output is different when extensions are enabled. This
adds api samples for those cases to give a more realistic view
to the user of what they might expect.

Change-Id: Iaa9a4c3a373dee41931c5dc4f1b805f09a05299f

commit_message:
Move setuptools-git dependency from being a requires of pbr, to being a
requires of anything pbr supplies dependencies for via the inject_requires
hook. (parse_requires is unaffected). Fixes bug 1058806.

Also ignore vim droppings.

Change-Id: I3b5328a7aeba967e6b64e4c200bcaf156ba2fd15

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-27 21:09:57.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Improve the idempotency of iscsi detach

When detaching an iscsi volume it is possible for the iscsi commands
to run concurrently, causing a target to be deleted by one greenthread
while the other is continuing. When removing the iscsi connection,
we should always ignore exit code 21 because that means that the
target has already been removed.

Fixes bug 1057719

Change-Id: I0c9f2623f85a817e2be506f9a6d523d45c76848a
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Improve the idempotency of iscsi detach

When detaching an iscsi volume it is possible for the iscsi commands
to run concurrently, causing a target to be deleted by one greenthread
while the other is continuing. When removing the iscsi connection,
we should always ignore exit code 21 because that means that the
target has already been removed.

Fixes bug 1057719

Change-Id: I0c9f2623f85a817e2be506f9a6d523d45c76848a

commit_message:
Revert "Add full test environment."

This reverts commit 30e513309fe25af358b4d9ed47da2c7574fc0f06.

The python mysql module was removed from test-requires in favor
of test-options, but the work to actually use that was never
completed.  Revert the change so that mysql testing is actually
performed again.

Change-Id: Iaf35811cc748272229260f2dab95520995a69b44

commit_message:
Max I/O ops per host scheduler filter

Provide ability to filter hosts based on the number of concurrent
build, resize, and image snapshot operations in progress.

FLAGS.max_io_ops_per_host is used to control the number of concurrent
permitted operations.

Change-Id: I77feca00a6b6b248de8423cef7fb8da2cf704930

commit_message:
Fix CloudPipe extension XML serialization

It is completely broken right now and this fixes it to properly
traverse a list of cloudpipe instance dictionaries, resulting
in XML output that matches the API spec.

Fixes bug: 1056242

Change-Id: Ic768afeaa76d776fd55a4f618d14fa41ed4c8a63

[{'created': '2012-09-12 22:35:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 105009, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6
'}, {'created': '2012-09-12 22:36:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6

commit_message:
Change wsgi Server class to Service

Also:
- use WritableLogger from common/log.py

Part of blueprint service-infrastructure

Change-Id: If41e592167bd4c308dd2a5d0226fcf3d8318f90d

This patch should be up for review after the Cinder client (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10597/) merge.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-18 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 4120, 'date': '2012-09-21 14:56:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Restored

There have been some issues around Snapshot delete in Cinder for Folsom release, specifically on Precise's kernel.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1023755 elaborates the issues.
The issue is still under review.

Tempest uses volumes >= 1G, which is when the delete Snapshot and fails.
This patch could wait until the bug is fixed."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-29 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-24 20:29:03.000000000', 'message': "Collect more accurate bandwidth data for XenServer

This changes the method used to poll xenserver for bandwidth data.
The reccomended way of collecting such data from xenserver (namely the
RRD files provided by the hosts) do not seem to be reliable, they
will sometimes be correct, often will be signifigantly under (> 10%),
and occasionally will show artifacts, such as phantom 4gb bandwidth
'spikes'.

This patch changes that to use the much simpler method of simply polling the
byte counters on the VIF network devices on the host. (We have old non-nova
code that does that on xenserver, and that method is known to work).

This should also make it much easier for other hypervisors other than
xenserver to implement bandwidth polling, as polling the counters is a rather
more universal method.

Fixes bug 1055737

Change-Id: I6a280d8bbfcc74914f888b11bc09349a270a5f58
"}, {'created': '2012-09-25 20:35:23.000000000', 'message': "Collect more accurate bandwidth data for XenServer

commit_message:
Collect more accurate bandwidth data for XenServer

This changes the method used to poll xenserver for bandwidth data.
The reccomended way of collecting such data from xenserver (namely the
RRD files provided by the hosts) do not seem to be reliable, they
will sometimes be correct, often will be signifigantly under (> 10%),
and occasionally will show artifacts, such as phantom 4gb bandwidth
'spikes'.

This patch changes that to use the much simpler method of simply polling the
byte counters on the VIF network devices on the host. (We have old non-nova
code that does that on xenserver, and that method is known to work).

This should also make it much easier for other hypervisors other than
xenserver to implement bandwidth polling, as polling the counters is a rather
more universal method.

Fixes bug 1055737

Change-Id: I6a280d8bbfcc74914f888b11bc09349a270a5f58

commit_message:
Remove run_test.py in favor of stock nose.

Move specific functionality into test fixtures, so that normal test runners
can work. For now, this means we can use unaltered nose. For the future, it
gets us closer to being able to use other test runners such as testrepository
which allow for things like parallel test runs and re-running failed tests
in a dev/test cycle.

Also, aligns keystone with nova and glance.

Change-Id: Ic1966281c0bdfbc09792360209692e9d4a0a51a7

commit_message:
Add new novaclient options to CLI guide

partially fixes bug 1057207

The following new options were added to novaclient
nova secgroup-list --all-tenants
nova network-list
nova network-show
nova flavor-key
nova show --minimal

This patch updates the list of commands and mentions the all-tenants
flag. Following this, new sections need to be created for
network-list, network-show, flavor-key and the --minimal flag

Anne's Patches: Make it output not as a long document.

Also fixes the PDF link for PDF download.

Change-Id: I3dde3586573407af2fc12a46f7f2c8143304b753

commit_message:
Remove extraneous db method image_property_update

The image_property_update method was being used internally to
the sqlalchemy db driver and duplicated functionality offered
by the equivalent private method _image_property_update.

Change-Id: Id01abd363ecd80a9b1c16626177157d4e0d77385

commit_message:
Synchronize docstring with actual implementation

This method no longer calls eventlet.sleep(0) since it's implicit any
time a database connection is checked out (which is a few times each
loop in this method).

Change-Id: Iff3c2e0fb2f7a11092b4d25c03a20beb3b24c91e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-21 22:21:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix errors with fdatasync on BSD platforms

Abstracts fdatasync/fsync/fcntl into an FsyncWrapper to determine, the
first time it is used, which fsync-like call is supported on the host
platform:

 - Linux: use fdatasync(fd) as Swift already does today.
 - Darwin: use fcntl(fd, F_FULLFSYNC), since Darwin provides the
   F_FULLFSYNC flag when you wish to fsync data you care about, ensuring
   that it is written to disk and not simply a buffer.
 - BSD/Other: use fsync for non-Darwin BSDs and as a fallback for other
   platforms.

Change-Id: Ibcfdeef7843b2f10cf8a17a6b989038ea2364376
'}, {'created': '2012-09-28 15:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix errors with fdatasync on BSD platforms

Abstracts fdatasync/fsync/fcntl into an FsyncWrapper to determine, the
first time it is used, which fsync-like call is supported on the host
platform:

 - Linux: use fdatasync(fd) as Swift already does today.
 - Darwin: use fcntl(fd, F_FULLFSYNC), since Darwin provides the
   F_FULLFSYNC flag when you wish to fsync data you care about, ensuring
   that it is written to disk and not simply a buffer.
 - BSD/Other: use fsync for non-Darwin BSDs and as a fallback for other
   platforms.

Change-Id: Ibcfdeef7843b2f10cf8a17a6b989038ea2364376
'}]
commit_message:
Fix errors with fdatasync on BSD platforms

Abstracts fdatasync/fsync/fcntl into an FsyncWrapper to determine, the
first time it is used, which fsync-like call is supported on the host
platform:

 - Linux: use fdatasync(fd) as Swift already does today.
 - Darwin: use fcntl(fd, F_FULLFSYNC), since Darwin provides the
   F_FULLFSYNC flag when you wish to fsync data you care about, ensuring
   that it is written to disk and not simply a buffer.
 - BSD/Other: use fsync for non-Darwin BSDs and as a fallback for other
   platforms.

Change-Id: Ibcfdeef7843b2f10cf8a17a6b989038ea2364376

commit_message:
Ignore the stackforge jenkins email address

Update generate_authors to ignore the email address
for the stackforge jenkins as well as the main openstack
jenkins, to ignore commits in the history of projects
that were on stackforge before moving over to the
main server (such as ceilometer).

Change-Id: I86d93ba0f358d5d33278847ba8de039642dd54b7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-28 15:27:53.000000000', 'message': "Replace builtin hash with MD5 to solve 32/64-bit issues.

It seems that Python's builtin hash returns different
values on 32-bit and 64-bit architectures, so it's
safer to use a well-defined hash like MD5.

bug 1050359

Change-Id: Ibb49f7b9028085d2aedaf05b94e1e1dcdf5e4cb4
"}]
commit_message:
Replace builtin hash with MD5 to solve 32/64-bit issues.

It seems that Python's builtin hash returns different
values on 32-bit and 64-bit architectures, so it's
safer to use a well-defined hash like MD5.

bug 1050359

Change-Id: Ibb49f7b9028085d2aedaf05b94e1e1dcdf5e4cb4

commit_message:
Do not prefer ALL_TENANTS environment variable to command line arguments

As pointed out in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/13708/ command line
arguments should have higher priority.

Also, do not fail if the environment variable is not representing an
int.

Change-Id: Ie6cd5b2d6aae47236ba0fe6d594d0c8095e9e422

Would it make sense to submit a change to glance to "fix" that, or is there a special reason for it being different?'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:58:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

And I agree with Doug's question. :)"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:56:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Doug, Julien,

I don't know if there's a justifiable reason for the default glance topic being different, other than I guess to allow a consumer easily receive glance notifications only, without being swamped by messages from the noisier notifiers like nova and then filtering manually on event_type.

I'd be a bit leery about changing the default at this stage though, in case it breaks any existing consumers.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-27 19:35:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Eoghan, OK, I guess that makes sense. Theoretically the routing key could be used to do that, too, but I guess that's an even bigger change."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-28 16:48:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

[{'created': '2012-09-27 09:53:42.000000000', 'message': 'Enable glance notifications for ceilometer

Two changes are required so that ceilometer can consume glance
notifications out-of-the-box in devstack:

 - configure glance to emit notifications if rabbitmq or qpid
   is enabled

 - configure the ceilometer collector to consume notifications
   on the default glance topic (glance_notifications.*)

Change-Id: I0eac223eddb615266e28447b18fcaaadcd40dddf
'}, {'created': '2012-09-27 15:31:40.000000000', 'message': 'Config for ceilometer gathering from glance

Some changes are required so that ceilometer can gather usage data
from glance (notification & polling) out-of-the-box in devstack:

 - configure glance to emit notifications if rabbitmq or qpid
   is enabled

 - configure the ceilometer collector to consume notifications
   on the default glance topic (glance_notifications.*)

 - pass credentials to ceilometer central agent so that it
   authtenticate polling calls to glance

Change-Id: I0eac223eddb615266e28447b18fcaaadcd40dddf
'}, {'created': '2012-09-27 17:03:07.000000000', 'message': 'Config for ceilometer gathering from glance

Some changes are required so that ceilometer can gather usage data
from glance (notification & polling) out-of-the-box in devstack:

 - configure glance to emit notifications if rabbitmq or qpid
   is enabled

 - configure the ceilometer collector to consume notifications
   on the default glance topic (glance_notifications.*)

 - pass credentials to ceilometer central agent so that it
   authtenticate polling calls to glance

Change-Id: I0eac223eddb615266e28447b18fcaaadcd40dddf
'}]
commit_message:
Config for ceilometer gathering from glance

Some changes are required so that ceilometer can gather usage data
from glance (notification & polling) out-of-the-box in devstack:

 - configure glance to emit notifications if rabbitmq or qpid
   is enabled

 - configure the ceilometer collector to consume notifications
   on the default glance topic (glance_notifications.*)

 - pass credentials to ceilometer central agent so that it
   authtenticate polling calls to glance

Change-Id: I0eac223eddb615266e28447b18fcaaadcd40dddf

[{'created': '2012-09-26 22:51:28.000000000', 'message': "xenapi: make it easier to recover from failed migrations

If a migration/resize fails, the source VM may or may not have it's name
changed in xapi. This makes recovering from a failed migration more
difficult than it needs to be. Moving the rename to be done first

Change-Id: I9296aa67af01d4a832bc63bcb9b71ee20b1221cc
"}]
commit_message:
xenapi: make it easier to recover from failed migrations

If a migration/resize fails, the source VM may or may not have it's name
changed in xapi. This makes recovering from a failed migration more
difficult than it needs to be. Moving the rename to be done first
ensures that it always be renamed.

Change-Id: I9296aa67af01d4a832bc63bcb9b71ee20b1221cc

commit_message:
Added compute node stats to HostState

Added compute node statistics to the HostState class for use
by scheduler filters.  These are statistics pre-computed on the
compute side of the house and are of general interest for filter
authors.

Change-Id: I6d979b1a9f26b8390c20b4ebbde3c9cb8f000396

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-28 16:55:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix dependency on anyjson

The main requirements.txt and the one for documentation
had different specification for anyjson.

This change also makes explicit the fact that we
do not require anything other than what is listed
in pip-requires to install. The library function
looks at requirements.txt, too, which we don't have
and should not use.

Change-Id: I8e79ad0803e3a9ebeb2a1dae30b2e5abdbbe8276
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dependency on anyjson

The main requirements.txt and the one for documentation
had different specification for anyjson.

This change also makes explicit the fact that we
do not require anything other than what is listed
in pip-requires to install. The library function
looks at requirements.txt, too, which we don't have
and should not use.

Change-Id: I8e79ad0803e3a9ebeb2a1dae30b2e5abdbbe8276
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Returning roles from authenticate in ldap backend

Without this fix the LDAP backend doesn't return
roles during the authentication phase.

lp 1035428

commit_message:
Add XML support for test cases under identity admin.

So far test_service.py is not ready. Create_service, list_service and delete_service
in XML/admin_client.py are not working properly. It seems that Keystone does
not support XML for service API. A bug has been raised at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1042144.
I have complied with the XML format as it described in
http://docs.rackspace.com/openstack-extensions/auth/OS-KSADM-admin-devguide/content/POST_addService_v2.0_OS-KSADM_services_Admin_API_Service_Developer_Operations-d1e1357.html

Change-Id: I60f72a0f99deff0bd8ee02bd2db5284d87481d5f

commit_message:
optimize slightly device lookup with LXC umounts

Only canonicalize the path once, rather than for
each entry in /proc/mounts.

Change-Id: I6e582b44f171a1c4cc151d615e9dcfae1e590a53
Reported-by: Kevin L. Mitchell

a meter for a given resource.

subject: Return a meaningful Error when token_id is missing
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-20 16:04:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There's nothing necessarily wrong with the fix, but I wouldn't expect a None value to *ever* be passed all the way down to the driver as a valid ID.

I assume assert_admin or something is producing the null value and trying to get() it from the token API... shouldn't recognize and shortcut the null case, rather than each driver individually?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-20 16:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-keystone-merge/1949 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/449 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/1964 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-keystone-python26/992 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/992 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/12385 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13368/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/2364 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2012-09-21 09:07:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Adding that check to assert_admin() was my first try to fix this problem. This doesn't however address the issue for the Service API. E.g. /tenants in the Service API is mapped to get_tenants_for_token() which doesn't call into assert_admin().
Fixing this in the drivers seemed to be the approach requiring the fewest code changes (and it's also how essex did it I think). Fixing this on a higher level seems to be harder because some calls (e.g. /extensions) don't require the X-Auth-Token Header to be present so we'd need to add separate checks to every API call, unless I overlooked something."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-21 14:34:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I assumed it was assert_admin() that was actually calling the token_api with token_id=None. If that's not the case, where is the call coming from? Calls like /extensions that don't need an X-Auth-Token shouldn't be hitting the backend at all."}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-24 16:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2062, 'date': '2012-09-25 08:26:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@dolph: Is not only assert_admin() that calls the token_api with a None token_id. There are a few methods that call the token_api without calling assert_admin() before. Unless I overlooked something this seems to true for:
Ec2Controller._assert_identity() in contrib/ec2/core.py, UserController.set_user_password in contrib/user_crud/core.py and TenantController.get_tenants_for_token() in identity/core.py.
So I decided it would be easier (and equally clean) to fix this in the backends than in all of the above places. Do you disagree?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-28 01:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-28 01:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-28 02:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Fails

Build failed

[{'created': '2012-09-20 15:36:16.000000000', 'message': 'Return a meaningful Error when token_id is missing

To make keystone return HTTP 401 Unauthorized instead of 500 Internal Server
Error when processing request that miss the X-Auth-Token Header.

Fixes Bug 1053474

Change-Id: Ib830fce7bb3b29fa1bc385f64c7c0ecdf5cd1644

commit_message:
Return a meaningful Error when token_id is missing

To make keystone return HTTP 401 Unauthorized instead of 500 Internal Server
Error when processing request that miss the X-Auth-Token Header.

Fixes Bug 1053474

Change-Id: Ib830fce7bb3b29fa1bc385f64c7c0ecdf5cd1644

commit_message:
Add duplicate device check in API

Fixes bug 1039002

Check at the API level that the device specified in volume-attach
is not already in use by the instance.

Change-Id: Ie5c92eb4b253b3e67114301f65cd98780004d967

commit_message:
Allow empty description for tenants.

Bug: 1025929

(based on the patch submitted by Ivan Bondarev)

* keystoneclient/v2_0/shell.py
  do_tenant_update(): Update description if it is defined.

* keystoneclient/v2_0/tenants.py
  Token.update(), TokenManager.update():
  Update description if it is defined, even if it's empty.

* tests/v2_0/test_tenants.py
  test_update_empty_description(): New test case for empty
  description.

Change-Id: I4c4e93f6bd5d38828685fd55eb1e694f521928e9

commit_message:
Change Cloudpipe API response

Fixes bug: 1056242

This patch changes the response to creation and list method of Cloudpipe API to
adapt it to a format that can be serialized to XML.
Also this patch changes the tests regarding CloudPipe.

Change-Id: I060ca1b497581f209fa78e94ea04948eea6d53b0

[{'created': '2012-09-14 08:50:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ssh.Client retval and deadlock danger LP#1038561

Returning tuples is not handy for further checking of error states.
Using exceptions with instead.

There was a possibility to deadlock when reading only stdout. Solved by
using `select`.

Change-Id: Iead3540a7bd0bfce3ad092620b86ef11b9f0b622
'}, {'created': '2012-09-14 09:55:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ssh.Client retval and deadlock danger LP#1038561

Returning tuples is not handy for further checking of error states.
Using exceptions with instead.

There was a possibility to deadlock when reading only stdout. Solved by
using `select`.

Change-Id: Iead3540a7bd0bfce3ad092620b86ef11b9f0b622
'}, {'created': '2012-09-14 10:29:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ssh.Client retval and deadlock danger LP#1038561

Returning tuples is not handy for further checking of error states.
Using exception with exit_status and stderr output as its args instead.

There was a possibility to deadlock when reading only stdout. Solved by
using `select`.

Change-Id: Iead3540a7bd0bfce3ad092620b86ef11b9f0b622
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ssh.Client retval and deadlock danger LP#1038561

Returning tuples is not handy for further checking of error states.
Using exception with exit_status and stderr output as its args instead.

There was a possibility to deadlock when reading only stdout. Solved by
using `select`.

Change-Id: Iead3540a7bd0bfce3ad092620b86ef11b9f0b622

commit_message:
Pass block_device_info to destroy in revert_resize

Passing block_device_info allows the driver to clean up block
device mappings (detaching) properly on the newly resized instance

Change-Id: I2527f883883c741dbf4d20be0ca33dbef6f9f36a

commit_message:
Add exchange_name parameter to TopicConsumer

In Ceilometer, we need to consume messages from different exchanges of type
'topic', so being able to specify the exchange name rather than using the
default in TopicConsumer is necessary.

This fixes bug #1055483

Change-Id: Ibbaec8496f24c0b221cf489258af1e7fe362e84a
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

subject: Remove Kombu/RabbitMQ from defaults
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/380/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/248/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/248/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/248/consoleFull : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I had accidentally added kombu to both test-requires and test-options. Fixed.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Looks like this is going to need some more work. Kombu is more coupled than it should be...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/381/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/249/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/249/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/249/consoleFull : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Russell:

* There are other options in Nova (and OpenStack) seem to default to stub/fake drivers.

* This is not political. If it was political, it wouldn't be any more political than the selection of virtualization drivers.  Could you claim bias because I'm the author of a competing rpc implementation? I suppose, but so are you. However, I'm concerned with the technical quality of the project and believe that having Kombu as a default is to the technical detriment to the other drivers, and to the abstraction itself.

* RabbitMQ/Kombu requires at least some level of configuration/setup, so it isn't really that out-of-the-box anyway. If you want to argue drop-in, turnkey ease-of-use, I can make a compelling argument for a configuration-less solution that doesn't require a server and could be put into place as a default... but that is another topic altogether and I don't want to digress into something that /could/ turn political. My point is that what is there now, really doesn't work out of the box.

* I believe that default to Kombu has led to single-minded use and testing, which has been the cause of proposed and even accepted changes into the RPC abstraction that are not sufficiently abstract. Code-reviews help, but the culture won't change without a change to the default.

* I believe the default to Kombu since the move to common has led to the case where consuming projects have only tested and perhaps even only considered Kombu in planning/implementation. This change might not change that entirely, but it should help."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Should kombu be the default forever and always? This isn't true of, say, the compute driver.

I understand the concern for upgrading and compatibility. However, with RPC now in common, this will only bake in more legacy as Kombu becomes the default for a larger number of consuming projects."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

One option to consider is adding a future_required kwarg on options to make a default option depreciated, pending a 'required' kwarg in a future release.

This might still be somewhat controversial, but I hope this is more agreeable."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-merge/486/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-pep8/354/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python26/354/consoleFull : FAILURE
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-openstack-common-python27/354/consoleFull : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Mark, this has been reworked.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-common/+spec/no-kombu-default'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Had to rebase the dependent patch (changes to cfg handling broke my new method to cfg.py)'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Restored

getting mark's removal of the -2; or additional comments would be great..."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Gerrit isn't the place to discuss this. Having kombu as the default is a decision made long ago and if we changed that here after a couple of reviews, it would catch an awful lot of people by surprise.

Please start a thread on openstack-dev with your suggestion."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Discussion ongoing on the list

Some points

fake isn't a good default - I'd just make None the default.

Projects which adopt RPC in folsom (e.g. Cinder and Quantum) don't need to go through a deprecation period. We need to allow Nova to set up a default before _get_impl() is called.

I think we need an API for to allow projects to configure RPC stuff - cfg is just for user configuration, but there's also options that users of the API want to set. Maybe CONF.set_default() would cut it, but I really intended that to just be for unit tests.

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-common/+bug/1031719"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Eric - it would be good to file a blueprint for this.

It's also something I'd like to do a rubber-stamp session on (or just bring it up in a more general openstack-common session) at the summit"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

The discussion was here:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-August/thread.html#445

My -2 is out of date at this point, so removing it again

Still need to mull over how best to do this - e.g. what we will want in Grizzly is a deprecation warning in Nova etc., but I think that Nova itself should supply the default rather than the API. We don't want new users of the API to get the deprecation warning"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This change needlessly breaks backwards compatibility for existing configurations.  I don't think it should be merged."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Alright, opinions thoroughly stated at this point.  I'll defer to Mark McLoughlin (effective PTL of common) for an opinion when he has time.."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm still not seeing any value to changing it at all.

1) Changing it at all breaks compatibility.  Any other benefit has to outweigh that.

2) The change is going from a default that works and is definitely the most common value for the option to something that does not work for anyone.

The only arguments I can see for changing around this option are political, not technical or to the benefit of users."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-26 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Remove Kombu/RabbitMQ from defaults

Following the behavior of other components in OpenStack,
such as the compute_driver, we should default to
a fake/stub driver.

Change-Id: I604d398f7a7599fc5ba53826b3f858fb331a33b3

Add test for image_tag_set_all

The sqlalchemy driver required a change to preserve the ordering
of the tag list.

Related to bp glance-simple-db-parity

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-21 18:30:04.000000000', 'message': "Enable list with no dict objects to be sorted in api samples

So far we had only dicts to be sorted. Although Aggregates extension has a
response case which a list of strings is returned and the current key
attribute didn't checked if the instance was a dict or another object which
caused a break in the use case above. This fix this, and use None as key to
compare if the element is not a dictionary instance.

Change-Id: Id5d31d1d2ad88fb538d8a9637a1969b179dd93ab
"}, {'created': '2012-09-21 18:46:47.000000000', 'message': "Enable list with no dict objects to be sorted in api samples

compare if the element is not a dictionary instance.

caused a break in the use case above. This fix this, and use None as key to
compare if the element is not a dictionary instance.

Change-Id: Id5d31d1d2ad88fb538d8a9637a1969b179dd93ab
"}]
commit_message:
Enable list with no dict objects to be sorted in api samples

So far we had only dicts to be sorted. Although Aggregates extension has a
response case which a list of strings is returned and the current key
attribute didn't checked if the instance was a dict or another object which
caused a break in the use case above. This fix this, and use None as key to
compare if the element is not a dictionary instance.

Change-Id: Id5d31d1d2ad88fb538d8a9637a1969b179dd93ab

commit_message:
implement sqlalchemy dbengine backend

implements bug #1021767

To sync db migration, for now use temporary
script tools/dbsync.  Modify it to point
to your db url (example 'sqlite:///ceilometer.db'
or 'mysql://user:mypass@localhost/ceilometer').
Also ensure the database_connection= in conf
files point to same db url.

Change-Id: I1c72b0a6b860738e94cf19666cb47db88ac9b251

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-27 08:36:54.000000000', 'message': 'Loosen anyjson dependency to avoid clash with ceilometer

Ceilometer depends on anyjson 0.3.1, whereas nova requires
exacly 0.2.4.

The net effect is a devstack with ceilometer installed will
appear to work initially, as ceilometer is sparked up after
nova. However, if any of the nova services are subsequently
restarted, they fail with:

  pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: anyjson==0.2.4

By simply allowing the nova anyjson dependency version to
be greater than as opposed to an exact match, we can avoid
the clash.

Change-Id: I21737a2504705f15dd16e6762b44624678177442
'}]
commit_message:
Loosen anyjson dependency to avoid clash with ceilometer

Ceilometer depends on anyjson 0.3.1, whereas nova requires
exacly 0.2.4.

The net effect is a devstack with ceilometer installed will
appear to work initially, as ceilometer is sparked up after
nova. However, if any of the nova services are subsequently
restarted, they fail with:

  pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: anyjson==0.2.4

By simply allowing the nova anyjson dependency version to
be greater than as opposed to an exact match, we can avoid
the clash.

Change-Id: I21737a2504705f15dd16e6762b44624678177442

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, I think the idea was to check the event type to decide the total should be returned (e.g. delta) or the max (e.g. cumulative).

(In case of absolute counter (e.g. like memory) the call would return max too I think, but we already know that has less sense anyway. Maybe we should return average for absolute counter, I don't know. The purpose of this counter is mainly to split objects in different objects according to this counter state)

I don't think there's a sense to get max for a delta, for example.


Now, it may be better to include in the response the type of value (total or max) than requesting explicitly from the "billing" system a max or a total, since it's likelty that Ceilometer will know how to deal with a counter based on its type, whereas the "billing" system may not have any clue.

WDYT?'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Updated inline comment to request change /max_volume to /volume/max.

Otherwise after discussion with Doug, this change is ok to have!"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

Nothing to say about the implementation so far, but a big question is about the necessity of this, and if should not be part of /volume.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We looked at having /volume figure it out, but the only place we have information about how to do that is in the meter events themselves. Was the idea to look at the data in the database to decide how to interpret the data in the database? It seemed better to have more explicit API calls to let the caller manage whether it wants the max or the total, as we did with duration.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the endpoint name Julien suggests and opened another ticket to handle the automatic meter-type detection in a /volume endpoint later.'}, {'account_id': 5200, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 18:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

subject: Listen for volume.delete.start instead of end
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/check/gate-ceilometer-merge/290 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/287 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/287 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/289 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why I set this to end is because if anything raises after start, you actually count and meter something that failed. So I though it was better to count at end time, when things are actually stopped for real and for sure.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

You're right Doug, I forgot we would anyway get a notification later, so we don't care that much!"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, the volume status must be available in order for it be attached or snapshot'd, so any attempted to initiate either action would fail while the volume is deleting.

In the light of that restriction, I don't think it should be considered part of the volume's billable lifecycle."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If the delete fails, we will still get an "exists" event later, right? So we will still measure the volume. But if it succeeds, then we may be charging the user for time that it takes us to remove a volume they aren't able to use (since I assume once the delete starts the volume is no longer available to them).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/gate/gate-ceilometer-merge/294 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/gate/gate-ceilometer-pep8/291 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/gate/gate-ceilometer-python26/291 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/13747/1/gate/gate-ceilometer-python27/293 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-27 17:15:00.000000000', 'message': "Listen for volume.delete.start instead of end

Fixes bug 1057462

Register interest in volume.delete.start events instead of
volume.delete.end so that the owner isn't charged for time
taken to tear down the volume.

Change-Id: Idf27876aff8a3ccb2a6f76679744c8513783d523
"}]
commit_message:
Listen for volume.delete.start instead of end

Fixes bug 1057462

Register interest in volume.delete.start events instead of
volume.delete.end so that the owner isn't charged for time
taken to tear down the volume.

Change-Id: Idf27876aff8a3ccb2a6f76679744c8513783d523

subject: Revised all examples to reference port 35357
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-20 17:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-26 10:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-26 10:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-26 11:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-26 11:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-26 11:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-26 11:40:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-09-26 18:23:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

35357 is the "admin" port. Is Keystone moving to using only one port? If not, then I would advise against telling people to *always* use the admin port to make calls. That rather breaks the separation of concerns that motivated there being a "regular" port and an "admin" port in the first place.

Can someone add some context?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-26 19:15:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The goal is for the v3 API to be identical regardless of which port it's accessed from (the only exception to that today is GET /v2.0/tenants). I'd like to continue to support deploying a subset of the API on an alternative port, but rather than using the port to dictate available functionality, use RBAC, and if there's any interest, a whilelisting middleware that could be optionally deployed in front of the v3 service, which 404's non-whitelisted calls."}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-09-26 19:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I'm certainly onboard with the goal there... this does encourage people to treat 35357 as the "default" port, though. I think that's better, really, since this port is properly registered and assigned... if people *want* a separate admin port I think it's fair for them to choose the port themselves.

All that said, I think it's probably worth moving towards making all this "official" and it would probably be a worthwhile note in the Grizzly release notes... (it's never too early to start on the release notes. ;-) )'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-26 19:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful

commit_message:
Update install guide for folsom:

- Point to cloud archive for ubuntu packages
- Add Folsom to release table
- Adds ch_installingfolsom.xml but doesn't xi:include it in book
file yet.

Patchset removes ch_installingfolsom.xml as I've patched the
other patch to make it an appendix.

Rebase against master.

Change-Id: I0b1d8ffa8f62e6c5b38e6ee0df7ee2e2dd456ddb

commit_message:
Modified the doc as per the best practice method.

Addresses comments from gongysh:
-Minor typo fixes and changed ch_filename.xml file to ap_filename.xml.
-Also trying to make the entire appendix conditionally output for ubuntu.

Subsequent patchsets ensure it acts like an appendix. We can move it
later if needed.

Change-Id: I6b622c6c067c7e750a867be471ea45253ec75909

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/13546/1/check/gate-devstack-merge/1227 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-24 12:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi Ken,

I also tripped over the same issue when running the ceilometer agent with devstack.

However I approached it differently, proposing a change to ceilometer to allow the creds be specified in a more standard way:

  https://review.openstack.org/13570

If that patch is accepted in ceilometer, then devstack would  only need to be changed as follows:

 -    screen_it ceilometer-acentral "cd $CEILOMETER_DIR && $CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-agent-central --config-file $CEILOMETER_AGENT_CONF"
 +    screen_it ceilometer-acentral "export OS_USERNAME=$OS_USERNAME OS_PASSWORD=$OS_PASSWORD OS_TENANT_NAME=$OS_TENANT_NAME OS_AUTH_URL=$OS_AUTH_URL && cd $CEILOMETER_DIR && $CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-agent central --config-file $CEILOMETER_AGENT_CONF"

Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 4277, 'date': '2012-09-25 05:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Both methods look good to me.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-09-25 10:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-09-25 10:41:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The change Eoghan mentioned above has merged into ceilometer, so the option names in this changeset should be updated before it is merged."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:33:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This change won't be required if/when the following larger patch lands: 

    https://review.openstack.org/13746

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 356, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

superseeded https://review.openstack.org/13746'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-24 13:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(14 inline comments)

please modify the pom.xml to copy the files under figtures to target dir:

                            <postProcess>
                                 <copy
                                    todir="${basedir}/target/docbkx/webhelp/${release.path.name}/openstack-network/admin/content/figures">
                                    <fileset
                                        dir="${basedir}/figures">
                                        <include name="**/*" />
                                    </fileset>
                                </copy>'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-24 13:11:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Also, as a sample setup which is working as a tutorial,  I think we should paste out the output of each output, and make bold some text in the output to show meaningful things.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-24 15:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (14 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-24 15:25:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-09-24 15:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-09-24 18:08:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Oh now I see the pom.xml issue - the lines are commented out so the action isn't happening post process. Uncomment and I think you'll be okay.

The only remaining possible problem is that the /figures/ dir should be named /images/ in the source so that the output references it correctly, but test and see."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-24 23:19:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-09-25 00:11:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (18 inline comments)

2 more points:
1: use bold instead of italic to make visual effect.
2: paste out all the output of the commands and make bold (if we can) the important part of the output.
