subject: Init based on third draft of Identity API v3
messages:
[{'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-19 19:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

won't be accurate shortly with the draft 4 changes, but a great initial implementation. Will want to recreate this off our final google docs draft."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-19 20:25:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Joe: I'd rather see us go in the opposite direction... version controlled markdown -> publishing (vs pushing disparate edits from google docs back into markdown periodically)"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-20 15:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-20 15:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Fixed a JSON sample & section header in patch 2 that I previously overlooked.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-20 15:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Dolph - totally in favor of versioned markdown - the google docs were simply to allow us to gather feedback on the docs in a reasonable fashion. As we check this in, where does it get published? Can we reference this MD rendered location as the canonical data from here on?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-20 15:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-20 17:09:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'll let Anne chime in, but a couple notes from me:

I liked Google docs as a venue for discussions as well. Yesterday I toyed with publishing from markdown to pdf/html and importing that into Google docs... I wasn't totally happy with the results (due to formatting issues on import), but I think it's still a possibility if we want to push out a fourth draft that way.

When this merges, we'll immediately have a page on github we can refer people to, a la glance's v2 spec: https://github.com/openstack/image-api/blob/master/openstack-image-service-api/src/markdown/images-api-v2.0.md

I think our link will be: https://github.com/openstack/identity-api/blob/master/openstack-identity-api/src/markdown/identity-api-v3.md

Long term, I believe Anne has a way to publish this where it really belongs: http://docs.openstack.org/api/"}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-20 17:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-09-26 10:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6, 'date': '2012-09-26 10:06:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:20:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Approved, conditional on a gentlemen's agreement that future changes will make this the official documentation of the API"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-27 15:20:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-identity-api-merge/22/ : SUCCESS'}]

commit_message:
Init based on third draft of Identity API v3

Link to the third draft on Google Docs: http://goo.gl/5YCl1

Differences from the above Google Doc:

- Fixed a few bits of broken JSON syntax
- Labeled request/responses accordingly
- Removed content that had been crossed out (e.g. policy extension)
- Added markdown syntax, of course

Change-Id: I619ed8b4cf54487d4d13d7b1acff9db6e8d268ff

commit_message:
Allow separate versioning of each API

Previously, all APIs used single versioning definition. Since these are
likely to change at different rates (AWS APIs are unlikely to change at
all, but OpenStack APIs probably will), give each their own version
definition.

Change-Id: I6985205dfcb5baf6f49ad32b091d811f97d1552a
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
update quantum setup to automatically add route to fixed_range

- allows metadata service to work out of the box for VMs in fixed_range
- allows direct access to VMs via their fixed_ips from the devstack host.

Change-Id: I24da91fdf184e195185462554c044ee6f65d58ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-09-27 13:51:38.000000000', 'message': 'heat API : return ResourceProperties as JSON

For boto to correctly parse the API DescribeStackEvents
action, the ResourceProperties key in the response
must be a string, as per the AWS spec, so we encode the
properties in a JSON blob

Fixes #245

Change-Id: Icd38984836a941ed4a012b06382933bb46f43c4f
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat API : return ResourceProperties as JSON

For boto to correctly parse the API DescribeStackEvents
action, the ResourceProperties key in the response
must be a string, as per the AWS spec, so we encode the
properties in a JSON blob

Fixes #245

Change-Id: Icd38984836a941ed4a012b06382933bb46f43c4f
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make the keystone service type configurable

We will eventually need to have clients for both the OpenStack and
CloudFormation-compatible APIs, and they will need to have different
service types.

Change-Id: I06ae727c17c245ae60934bbed6e1631c7ad5fd77
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-19 16:23:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yep, vishy is right. We can't change active migrations if they aren't completely broken. Michael Still is adding a new migration that addresses this to the degree we should for now."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-19 16:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Well, I thought he was. The only thing we can do here is to add a new migration that re-adds the one missing FK (the snapshots.volume_id column). The other FKs are actually getting readded due to some sqlalchemy magic. Sync up with michael to see where to take this patch.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-27 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix incorrect FK delete/create in migration 090

Migration 090_modify_volume_id_datatype was using the FK's
it read in from the tables to recreate FK's after deletion when
making data type changes.

This happened to work, but was wrong, so instead we now
gather the list of keys before and save it for use later when
it's time to recreate.

Two lists are used, one of the keys we are changing the type on and
will set the FK dependency back on, and the other is a set of FK's
that we intentionally will NOT set the FK dependency on.

More importantly this patch adds test_migration_90 which will verify
that we changed the ID data types to VARCHAR(36) and that the keys
we expect to be FK's are actually set correctly.

We intentionally dropped the FK dependency from the snapshot table,
it seems that we may want to reset this, however currently that would
require a model change and sync to cinder and right now it doesn't
seem to be an issue so it's left as intended here.

Addresses bug #1052252

Change-Id: I48b71531b065f536d1a5d5f0965b471c48820509

commit_message:
Delete nova serializers and add glance serializers.

This commit allow us to eliminte nova/wsgi.py and glance/common/wsgi.py.
Use the glance serializers as the nova ones are still in
nova/api/wsgi.py

Part of blueprint wsgi-common

Change-Id: I5fa1821444f725e5b1b7fd3b6d90367214448f65
